Lv 51  G 328826 | M'mog's Tavern (S)
[**> PK <**] >>   *[NOEXP]* 
s
Deception Boulevard
  Traffic picks up quite a bit on this broad avenue.  Demons and Damned
alike move purposefully on their way to and from the market and Pandemonium
City's most popular tavern.  The biggest danger here is usually the
pickpockets that work the crowds.  Those who dare to leave trash here run
the risk of annoying the City Guards, so the road tends to be clear of
debris.  Somehow even the air seems cleaner, though the odor of sulphur is
never eliminated completely.  

[ Exits: north east west ]
A Damned soul slinks along warily.

n
The Twisting Gates
  Set safely away from the chasm is a pair of gates towering even over the
tallest demon.  One might guess they're made of some metal, to judge from
the rust, except that metal doesn't normally twist and bend as if in pain. 
They must be the source of the low moans filtering through the hot air.

s
Avenue of Greed
  Definitely a better neighborhood, this short avenue is lined with tall
buildings of both the residential and commercial type.  Damned aren't quite
as prevalent here, and those that do wander down the street tend to slink,
hoping to avoid attracting attention.  Of course, the demons continue to
strut proudly.  It's here that the ground is no longer as treacherous
underfoot, and actually well-maintained, if oddly soft, brick.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A Damned soul slinks along warily.

[*Daily Blessing*] 1092/1092 HP  1495/1495 MP  1321/1322 mv  890tnl  
Lv 51  G 328826 | Avenue of Greed (NESW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
w
The Iron Maiden (G)
  A high class establishment, the Iron Maiden is -the- place to be seen for
aspiring demons.  Nobles frequent the place, and often reserve it for their
private parties.  Damned servants scurry to serve the patrons, and woe
betide one that drops a drink.  They usually end up on the menu.  It tends
to lend an even darker atmosphere to the dimly lit club, as they move among
clusters of tables and dodge those dancing to the wailing, discordant music.

[ Exits: east ]
Lord Mulciber relaxes, drinking a cup of the finest blackwine.

The Cathedral
  Planed wooden floors.  Pews.  An altar.  Stained glass windows. 
Everything a cathedral should be, even if this is an odd place to find one. 
But the Church of Free Will is strong in the city, despite the strange fact
that a Damned leads it.  There are those who whisper and mutter about it,
but never where they can be overheard.

Blood Alley

then.  The stench is largely ignored in favor of making sure one stays
alive.  For this is one of the favorite haunts for muggers and those looking
to spill a little blood just for fun, and every being that walks through is
careful to keep a weapon close at hand.

help campaigns
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : Campaigns.
Help Category : Features.
Related Helps : CP Rules, Hunt Trick, Quest, Targeting, S&D.
Last Updated  : 2020-09-12 13:57:46.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Syntax:  campaign         : Lists all campaign commands.
         campaign request : Command to request a new campaign.
         campaign info    : List current CP mobs or check if CP is available.
         campaign check   : Lists mobs left in current campaign.
         campaign brief   : Shorter version of 'campaign check'.
         campaign quit    : Removes you from your current CP.
         campaign today   : Show campaigns done so far today.

Campaigns are a mix of the regular questing system and Global Quests with
a bit of extra challenge.  You are assigned a handful of monsters to kill,
which are slightly higher level and spread across many areas.  For the
extra effort, rewards are higher than those from regular quests.

To request a campaign, find Commander Barcett above Hester's Whoswhatsit
off Starlight Way in Aylor (the 'find' command will help) and 'campaign
request'. You can also request a campaign at any Questmaster.

You may undertake only one campaign per level.  If you request a campaign
and level while completing it, you may take another campaign at the new
level.  Campaigns do not stack, however; if you level more than once while
on a campaign, you do not get to take two additional campaigns at the new
level.  See 'help noexp' to prevent extra leveling while on campaigns.

Superheroes may take new campaigns every 2 hours (provided the previous
campaign is completed).  Superhero campaigns will generally have more 
targets than other campaigns.

Like quests, campaigns do have a time limit (though it is much longer than
quests); unlike quests, this timer counts down whether online or offline,
and you may quit the game without losing your campaign.

'campaign info' will tell you if you may campaign at the current level, or
your current campaign's level, rewards, and list of targets.  'campaign
check' strips most of this information and lists only the targets you have
yet to kill.  There is no [QUEST] flag on campaign targets.

Most campaigns will list your target's name and the area in which they are
located.  Some campaigns will only list the room name rather than the area.
If a monster on your list is killed in a room name campaign, it will list
the area instead until it returns.

If, for any reason, you do not wish to continue your campaign, you may use
'campaign quit' to abandon it.  You do not get any rewards and must level
before taking another campaign.  Once you kill your last target, rewards
are given automatically; there is no command to complete a campaign.

Your first campaign each day (real life calendar day based on the MUD's
time zone) will result in bonus quest points once it is completed. While
redoing a 9th tier, campaign rewards will start to reduce after the first
30 campaigns per day.

Once in a while, you may kill a mob listed as a campaign target and not
receive credit for it.  99% of the time, this is not a bug.  See 'help
mobkeys' for more information.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

[*Daily Blessing*] 1092/1092 HP  1495/1495 MP  1322/1322 mv  890tnl  
Lv 51  G 328826 | The Twisting Gates (NESW)

s
>>   *[NOEXP]* Malice Bridge
  Crossing a vast chasm several miles across, this bridge is wide enough
for an army to march across without crowding.  Carved from the very stone
thrusting out from the ground, it needs no extraneous support structure. 
Still, a look over the side into the bottomless canyon below is enough to
induce vertigo and fervent hopes for the span's continued stability.  

[ Exits: north south down ]
A Damned soul slinks along warily.

[*Daily Blessing*] 1092/1092 HP  1495/1495 MP  1319/1322 mv  890tnl  
Lv 51  G 328826 | Malice Bridge (NSD)
>>   *[NOEXP]* The Warren
  Red dust blown by winds of almost unbearable heat turns everything, even
the very air, the color of dried blood.  Where it comes from, nobody knows,
for the ground has been packed into stony hardness broken by dark cracks. 
This is the Warren- a sprawling collection of ramshackle hovels stretching
as far as the eye can see.  The stench of sulfur hangs heavy in the air. 
Not a pleasant place to live.  

[ Exits: north east west up ]

The Warren
  Red dust blown by winds of almost unbearable heat turns everything, even
the very air, the color of dried blood. Where it comes from, nobody knows,
for the ground has been packed into stony hardness broken by dark cracks.
This is the Warren- a sprawling collection of ramshackle hovels stretching
as far as the eye can see. The stench of sulfur hangs heavy in the air,
and gleaming eyes show from behind loose boards and piles of rubble.
Not a pleasant place to live.

>>   *[NOEXP]* The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.

enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.

stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the

On a jungle path
  A muddy bank leads to a narrow path threading around these huge trees. 
The oppressive humidity of the jungle presses down on you like a hot, wet
sheet.  The thick canopy overhead only allows dim green light to filter
through.  The path leads off to the east and the river is back to the south.

[ Exits: east south ]
     A tamarind tree grows here.
     These vines hang from many trees.
A fat, reddish-feathered bird pecks at the ground.

occasional glimpses of small mammals and reptiles.  The calls of various
brightly colored birds are sharp notes against the soothing drone of
insects.  Nearby, you can smell the fragrant bark of a cinnamon tree.

>>   *[NOEXP]* 
On an old bridge
  Here is the most dilapidated bridge you have ever seen!  Its weathered
grey planks are splintered and broken and more than half of them are
missing.  You look over the edge to see the rotting pilings sunk deep into
the mud banks.  Apparently, there is no other way across.  Gathering your
courage, you take one slow, careful step out onto the bridge.  It shudders
and groans under your weight.  I hope you make it across!  

[ Exits: north south ]

mountain and the cliffs on either side allow you shelter from the winds,

hazardous surface to walk up. Best to walk carefully.

A damp tundra (1314)

The twin pines
  You are standing before a tall pine tree. Legend has it that this tree was 
planted with its twin to celebrate the life and love of Rythemus and Lantana.
They died tragically in this spot. Upon their death the land grew cold and 
barren. Their friend, Thylinimus, planted these two trees as a memorial, and 
the trees immediately began to grow. These two trees still survive as a 
symbol of their love and devotion to each other - one of the signs of hope on
this desolate tundra.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
This pine tree grows healthy and vibrant, a sign of hope.

A Barren Wasteland
  All you can see, stretching far into the horizon, is a barren wasteland. 
The ground has been leeched of moisture, and is hard as rock underfoot,
laced with infinite cracks.  There's a few stunted trees, but they're
twisted and charred and lack any greenery.  The only anomaly is a narrow
hole in the ground.

d
The Warren
  Red dust blown by winds of almost unbearable heat turns everything, even
the very air, the color of dried blood.  Where it comes from, nobody knows,
for the ground has been packed into stony hardness broken by dark cracks. 
This is the Warren- a sprawling collection of ramshackle hovels stretching
as far as the eye can see.  The stench of sulfur hangs heavy in the air. 
Not a pleasant place to live.  

[ Exits: north east west up ]

  Red dust blown by winds of almost unbearable heat turns everything, even

>>   *[NOEXP]* Malice Bridge
  Crossing a vast chasm several miles across, this bridge is wide enough
for an army to march across without crowding.  Carved from the very stone
thrusting out from the ground, it needs no extraneous support structure. 
Still, a look over the side into the bottomless canyon below is enough to
induce vertigo and fervent hopes for the span's continued stability.

>>   *[NOEXP]* 
n
The Twisting Gates
  Set safely away from the chasm is a pair of gates towering even over the
tallest demon.  One might guess they're made of some metal, to judge from
the rust, except that metal doesn't normally twist and bend as if in pain. 
They must be the source of the low moans filtering through the hot air.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]

Blood Alley
  It's along this alley that the majority of the city's citizens live. 
It's a narrow alley, and nobody seems to care that trash chokes it now and
then.  The stench is largely ignored in favor of making sure one stays
alive.  For this is one of the favorite haunts for muggers and those looking
to spill a little blood just for fun, and every being that walks through is
careful to keep a weapon close at hand.  

[ Exits: east west ]

[Newbie] (Helper) Epsilon: It's worth trying to read 100% of the time, and it's useful or
entertaining probably 90% of the time. :P

e
Deception Boulevard
  Traffic picks up quite a bit on this broad avenue.  Demons and Damned
alike move purposefully on their way to and from the market and Pandemonium
City's most popular tavern.  The biggest danger here is usually the
pickpockets that work the crowds.  Those who dare to leave trash here run
the risk of annoying the City Guards, so the road tends to be clear of
debris. Somehow even the air seems cleaner, though the odor of sulphur
is never eliminated completely.  

[ Exits: east west ]

[*Daily Blessing*] 179/1092 HP  1075/1495 MP  1321/1322 mv  900tnl  
Lv 51  G 329318 | Deception Boulevard (EW)

  Traffic picks up quite a bit on this broad avenue.  Demons and Damned

e
Pandemonium Marketplace
  Easily the busiest place in the city, the Pandemonium Marketplace is a
broad square of flagstone easily covering half an acre.  Not only shops are
available here, but kiosks can be, and are, set up as well.  Every item
imaginable is available here, and at all hours of the day and night.  The
buzz of deals being struck can be constantly heard, interspersed with a
shout now and then as those dickering get a bit excited.  

[ Exits: (north) east south west ]
A Damned soul slinks along warily.

s
The Rialto
  The Rialto is a general store, selling a little bit of everything.  Need
some travel rations for that long journey?  This is the place to acquire
them.  Or how about a wilted flower for that special someone?  A cloak to
hide your lovely features while you assassinate that demon lord?  Got one,
right here.  Feel free to browse, but if you break it, you buy it.  And that
includes the staff.  

[ Exits: north ]

>>   *[NOEXP]* Avenue of Greed
  Definitely a better neighborhood, this short avenue is lined with tall
buildings of both the residential and commercial type.  Damned aren't quite
as prevalent here, and those that do wander down the street tend to slink,
hoping to avoid attracting attention.  Of course, the demons continue to
strut proudly.  It's here that the ground is no longer as treacherous
underfoot, and actually well-maintained, if oddly soft, brick.

w
The Iron Maiden (G)
  A high class establishment, the Iron Maiden is -the- place to be seen for
aspiring demons.  Nobles frequent the place, and often reserve it for their
private parties.  Damned servants scurry to serve the patrons, and woe
betide one that drops a drink.  They usually end up on the menu.  It tends
to lend an even darker atmosphere to the dimly lit club, as they move among
clusters of tables and dodge those dancing to the wailing, discordant music.

[ Exits: east ]
(White Aura) Lord Mulciber relaxes, drinking a cup of the finest blackwine.

>>   *[NOEXP]* The Cathedral
  Planed wooden floors.  Pews.  An altar.  Stained glass windows. 
Everything a cathedral should be, even if this is an odd place to find one. 
But the Church of Free Will is strong in the city, despite the strange fact
that a Damned leads it.  There are those who whisper and mutter about it,
but never where they can be overheard.

  Definitely a better neighborhood, this short avenue is lined with tall
buildings of both the residential and commercial type.  Damned aren't quite
as prevalent here, and those that do wander down the street tend to slink,
hoping to avoid attracting attention.  Of course, the demons continue to
strut proudly.  It's here that the ground is no longer as treacherous
underfoot, and actually well-maintained, if oddly soft, brick.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A Damned soul slinks along warily.
A Damned soul slinks along warily.

[*Daily Blessing*] 205/1092 HP  1107/1495 MP  1314/1322 mv  900tnl

  Set safely away from the chasm is a pair of gates towering even over the
tallest demon.  One might guess they're made of some metal, to judge from
the rust, except that metal doesn't normally twist and bend as if in pain. 
They must be the source of the low moans filtering through the hot air.

>>   *[NOEXP]* 


e
Deception Boulevard
  Traffic picks up quite a bit on this broad avenue.  Demons and Damned
alike move purposefully on their way to and from the market and Pandemonium
City's most popular tavern.  The biggest danger here is usually the
pickpockets that work the crowds.  Those who dare to leave trash here run
the risk of annoying the City Guards, so the road tends to be clear of
debris. Somehow even the air seems cleaner, though the odor of sulphur
is never eliminated completely.  

[ Exits: east west ]

[*Daily Blessing*] 236/1092 HP  1152/1495 MP  1321/1322 mv  900tnl  
Lv 51  G 329318 | Deception Boulevard (EW)
>>   *[NOEXP]*

[*Daily Blessing*] 260/1092 HP  1189/1495 MP  1319/1322 mv  900tnl  
Lv 51  G 329318 | The Twisting Gates (NESW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* Malice Bridge
  Crossing a vast chasm several miles across, this bridge is wide enough
for an army to march across without crowding.  Carved from the very stone
thrusting out from the ground, it needs no extraneous support structure. 
Still, a look over the side into the bottomless canyon below is enough to
induce vertigo and fervent hopes for the span's continued stability.  

[ Exits: north south down ]
A Damned soul slinks along warily.
A Damned soul slinks along warily.

[*Daily Blessing*] 260/1092 HP  1189/1495 MP  1318/1322 mv  900tnl  
Lv 51  G 329318 | Malice Bridge (NSD)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
d
The Bottomless Chasm (G)
  There's literally no end to this chasm.  A falling being will never hit
bottom- kind of a mixed blessing- and the canyon continues in a perfect
circle around Pandemonium City.  Even those who can fly have trouble here,
battered and tossed about by stinking, gale force winds.  Were it not for
the bridge above, the City would be almost impossible to reach.  

[ Exits: up ]

[*Daily Blessing*] 260/1092 HP  1189/1495 MP  1315/1322 mv  900tnl  
Lv 51  G 329318 | The Bottomless Chasm (U)

Lv 51  G 329318 | Malice Bridge (NSD)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
s
The Warren
  Red dust blown by winds of almost unbearable heat turns everything, even
the very air, the color of dried blood.  Where it comes from, nobody knows,
for the ground has been packed into stony hardness broken by dark cracks. 
This is the Warren- a sprawling collection of ramshackle hovels stretching
as far as the eye can see.  The stench of sulfur hangs heavy in the air. 
Not a pleasant place to live.  

[ Exits: north east west up ]

d
Underground Haven
  A place of relative safety?  Perhaps.  Certainly there's less tension in
the air here, and laughter can actually be detected.  It's a fairly
decent-sized cave, and some effort has been made to provide a measure of
comfort.  Rickety chairs, a few tables, and even piles of blankets are
available for those able to escape the Warren for at least a few minutes.  

[ Exits: up ]

Blood Alley (1318)

Blood Alley (1317)

Blood Alley
  It's along this alley that the majority of the city's citizens live. 
It's a narrow alley, and nobody seems to care that trash chokes it now and
then.  The stench is largely ignored in favor of making sure one stays
alive.  For this is one of the favorite haunts for muggers and those looking
to spill a little blood just for fun, and every being that walks through is
careful to keep a weapon close at hand.  

[ Exits: north east down ]
     A bunch of colorful precious stones lie here, scattered and twinkling.
(White Aura) A soldier of Orcus is making sure his uniform hangs just right.
A soldier of Nephelus glares coldly at you.

Outside the Aylorian Academy (G)
  Standing before the main entrance of the Aylorian Academy, you can't help but
notice the sheer scale of the structure. Many famous adventurers have passed 
through these gates before you and many will follow. The mark you will leave 
on this realm is to be determined by your actions, by fate, by skill and by 
chance.

>>   *[NOEXP]* The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Dread Fields (1291)

A Barren Wasteland
  All you can see, stretching far into the horizon, is a barren wasteland. 
The ground has been leeched of moisture, and is hard as rock underfoot,
laced with infinite cracks.  There's a few stunted trees, but they're
twisted and charred and lack any greenery.  The only anomaly is a narrow
hole in the ground.  

[ Exits: east down ]

A Damned soul slinks along warily.
A Damned soul slinks along warily.

[*Daily Blessing*] 366/1092 HP  1335/1495 MP  1270/1322 mv  900tnl  
Lv 51  G 329318 | Malice Bridge (NSD)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
n
The Twisting Gates
  Set safely away from the chasm is a pair of gates towering even over the
tallest demon.  One might guess they're made of some metal, to judge from
the rust, except that metal doesn't normally twist and bend as if in pain. 
They must be the source of the low moans filtering through the hot air.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A City Guard stands proudly at his post.
A City Guard stands proudly at his post.

[*Daily Blessing*] 366/1092 HP  1335/1495 MP  1267/1322 mv  900tnl  
Lv 51  G 329318 | The Twisting Gates (NESW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
n
Avenue of Greed
  Definitely a better neighborhood, this short avenue is lined with tall
buildings of both the residential and commercial type.  Damned aren't quite
as prevalent here, and those that do wander down the street tend to slink,
hoping to avoid attracting attention.  Of course, the demons continue to
strut proudly.  It's here that the ground is no longer as treacherous
underfoot, and actually well-maintained, if oddly soft, brick.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A Damned soul slinks along warily.

[*Daily Blessing*] 366/1092 HP  1335/1495 MP  1266/1322 mv  900tnl  
Lv 51  G 329318 | Avenue of Greed (NESW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
n
The Plaza Gates
  Almost as formidable as the gates at the City's entrance, these protect
Pandemonium's nobility from invasion of their elite sanctum.  The road
slopes upward sharply, as if discouraging would-be treaders, and the City
Guard stationed at the gate itself looks none too friendly.  

[ Exits: north south ]
A City Guard stands proudly at his post.
The guard posted here glares at you suspiciously.
A City Guard exclaims, "You'd better have a pass if you're thinking of
 entering the Royal Plaza, mortal!"

Avenue of Greed
  Definitely a better neighborhood, this short avenue is lined with tall

[*Daily Blessing*] 382/1092 HP  1367/1495 MP  1315/1322 mv  900tnl  
Lv 51  G 329318 | Avenue of Greed (NESW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
w
The Iron Maiden (G)
  A high class establishment, the Iron Maiden is -the- place to be seen for
aspiring demons.  Nobles frequent the place, and often reserve it for their
private parties.  Damned servants scurry to serve the patrons, and woe
betide one that drops a drink.  They usually end up on the menu.  It tends
to lend an even darker atmosphere to the dimly lit club, as they move among
clusters of tables and dodge those dancing to the wailing, discordant music.

[ Exits: east ]
Lord Mulciber relaxes, drinking a cup of the finest blackwine.

>>   *[NOEXP]* The Cathedral
  Planed wooden floors.  Pews.  An altar.  Stained glass windows. 
Everything a cathedral should be, even if this is an odd place to find one. 
But the Church of Free Will is strong in the city, despite the strange fact
that a Damned leads it.  There are those who whisper and mutter about it,
but never where they can be overheard.  

[ Exits: west ]
The Pontiff of the Church of Free Will welcomes you.

>>   *[NOEXP]* 
Blood Alley
  It's along this alley that the majority of the city's citizens live. 
It's a narrow alley, and nobody seems to care that trash chokes it now and
then.  The stench is largely ignored in favor of making sure one stays
alive.  For this is one of the favorite haunts for muggers and those looking
to spill a little blood just for fun, and every being that walks through is
careful to keep a weapon close at hand.  

[ Exits: east west ]

A soldier of Nephelus glares coldly at you.

>>   *[NOEXP]* 
n
The Arena [**> PK <**]
  The arena is quite long, giving anybody who wants to practice their
combat skills plenty of room.  Demons who bear allegiance to no Prince, the
gladiators owned by the city, and even Damned are welcome here.  There's
even practice weapons of all types provided.  Of course, there's a downside
to all this generosity- fight /too/ well, and one might find themselves
forced into death combat for the entertainment of the masses.  Still, that
doesn't keep would-be warriors from flocking to the Arena, and the sounds of
combat never die away.  

[ Exits: east south ]
A practicing demon tries to make himself worthy of employment.
A gladiator intently practices the fine art of combat.
A gladiator intently practices the fine art of combat.

s
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
Malice Bridge
  Crossing a vast chasm several miles across, this bridge is wide enough
for an army to march across without crowding.  Carved from the very stone
thrusting out from the ground, it needs no extraneous support structure. 
Still, a look over the side into the bottomless canyon below is enough to
induce vertigo and fervent hopes for the span's continued stability.  

[ Exits: north south down ]
A Damned soul slinks along warily.
A Damned soul slinks along warily.

[*Daily Blessing*] 382/1092 HP  1367/1495 MP  1296/1322 mv  900tnl  
Lv 51  G 329318 | Malice Bridge (NSD)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
s
The Warren
  Red dust blown by winds of almost unbearable heat turns everything, even
the very air, the color of dried blood.  Where it comes from, nobody knows,
for the ground has been packed into stony hardness broken by dark cracks. 
This is the Warren- a sprawling collection of ramshackle hovels stretching
as far as the eye can see.  The stench of sulfur hangs heavy in the air. 
Not a pleasant place to live.  

[ Exits: north east west up ]
A Damned soul slinks along warily.

[*Daily Blessing*] 382/1092 HP  1367/1495 MP  1293/1322 mv  900tnl  
Lv 51  G 329318 | The Warren (NEWU)

[*Daily Blessing*] 399/1092 HP  1403/1495 MP  1318/1322 mv  900tnl  
Lv 51  G 329318 | The Cathedral (W)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
w
w
Avenue of Greed
  Definitely a better neighborhood, this short avenue is lined with tall
buildings of both the residential and commercial type.  Damned aren't quite
as prevalent here, and those that do wander down the street tend to slink,
hoping to avoid attracting attention.  Of course, the demons continue to
strut proudly.  It's here that the ground is no longer as treacherous
underfoot, and actually well-maintained, if oddly soft, brick.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]

[*Daily Blessing*] 399/1092 HP  1403/1495 MP  1318/1322 mv  900tnl  
Lv 51  G 329318 | Avenue of Greed (NESW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* The Iron Maiden (G)
  A high class establishment, the Iron Maiden is -the- place to be seen for
aspiring demons.  Nobles frequent the place, and often reserve it for their
private parties.  Damned servants scurry to serve the patrons, and woe
betide one that drops a drink.  They usually end up on the menu.  It tends
to lend an even darker atmosphere to the dimly lit club, as they move among
clusters of tables and dodge those dancing to the wailing, discordant music.

[ Exits: east ]
Lord Mulciber relaxes, drinking a cup of the finest blackwine.

e
Avenue of Greed
  Definitely a better neighborhood, this short avenue is lined with tall
buildings of both the residential and commercial type.  Damned aren't quite
as prevalent here, and those that do wander down the street tend to slink,
hoping to avoid attracting attention.  Of course, the demons continue to
strut proudly.  It's here that the ground is no longer as treacherous
underfoot, and actually well-maintained, if oddly soft, brick.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]

[*Daily Blessing*] 424/1092 HP  1436/1495 MP  1322/1322 mv  900tnl  
Lv 51  G 329318 | Avenue of Greed (NESW)
s
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
The Twisting Gates
  Set safely away from the chasm is a pair of gates towering even over the
tallest demon.  One might guess they're made of some metal, to judge from
the rust, except that metal doesn't normally twist and bend as if in pain. 
They must be the source of the low moans filtering through the hot air.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]

A City Guard stands proudly at his post.

w
read graffiti
Blood Alley
  It's along this alley that the majority of the city's citizens live. 
It's a narrow alley, and nobody seems to care that trash chokes it now and
then.  The stench is largely ignored in favor of making sure one stays
alive.  For this is one of the favorite haunts for muggers and those looking
to spill a little blood just for fun, and every being that walks through is
careful to keep a weapon close at hand.  

[ Exits: east west ]
A soldier of Nephelus glares coldly at you.
A soldier of Nephelus glares coldly at you.

The Twisting Gates
  Set safely away from the chasm is a pair of gates towering even over the
tallest demon.  One might guess they're made of some metal, to judge from
the rust, except that metal doesn't normally twist and bend as if in pain. 
They must be the source of the low moans filtering through the hot air.

[*Daily Blessing*] 424/1092 HP  1436/1495 MP  1319/1322 mv  900tnl  
Lv 51  G 329318 | The Twisting Gates (NESW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* Deception Boulevard
  Traffic picks up quite a bit on this broad avenue.  Demons and Damned
alike move purposefully on their way to and from the market and Pandemonium
City's most popular tavern.  The biggest danger here is usually the
pickpockets that work the crowds.  Those who dare to leave trash here run
the risk of annoying the City Guards, so the road tends to be clear of
debris. Somehow even the air seems cleaner, though the odor of sulphur
is never eliminated completely.  

[ Exits: east west ]

private parties.  Damned servants scurry to serve the patrons, and woe

The Plaza Gates
  Almost as formidable as the gates at the City's entrance, these protect

slopes upward sharply, as if discouraging would-be treaders, and the City
Guard stationed at the gate itself looks none too friendly.

n
M'mog's Tavern [**> PK <**]
  Raucous laughter spills from this dimly lit tavern into the street
outside.  There's no proper door leading into the place, just a hole in the
wall, and those entering are neatly framed against the crimson light
outside.  A number of tables are available, all frozen and molded in various
entertaining shapes from hapless Damned.  Demons are allowed on the
furniture.  Damned have to be content with occupying a mucky pit in the
corner.  Business is good, and M'mog has hired a number of imps to serve his
customers.  The patrons tend to treat the staff well, lest their drinks
be...  altered.  

[ Exits: south ]
A City Guard relaxes at a table, enjoying his off-duty hours.
An imp flutters about on its tiny wings, serving drinks.
An imp flutters about on its tiny wings, serving drinks.
A City Guard relaxes at a table, enjoying his off-duty hours.
M'mog stands with folded arms, coolly watching his staff serve drinks.

>>   *[NOEXP]* Pandemonium Marketplace
  Easily the busiest place in the city, the Pandemonium Marketplace is a
broad square of flagstone easily covering half an acre.  Not only shops are
available here, but kiosks can be, and are, set up as well.  Every item
imaginable is available here, and at all hours of the day and night.  The
buzz of deals being struck can be constantly heard, interspersed with a
shout now and then as those dickering get a bit excited.  

[ Exits: (north) east south west ]

[*Daily Blessing*] 460/1092 HP  1305/1495 MP  1238/1322 mv  900tnl  
Lv 51  G 329243 | Pandemonium Marketplace (NESW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
help graffiti
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : Graffiti.
Help Category : Miscellaneous.
Related Helps : Look, Rlook.
Last Updated  : 2023-01-28 13:14:46.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Syntax: graffiti add <message>   Adds graffiti to a room (199 char max)
        graffiti perm <message>  Writes permanent message (can't be cleared)
        graffiti clear           Removes non-permanent graffiti
        graffiti clear clanpays  Removes clan hall graffiti (leader only)

Graffiti allows you to leave a hidden message in a room that other players
may find later.  Rooms with graffiti will have a (G) appended to the end of
the room name (e.g., 'Center Square (G)'.  Simply 'look graffiti' to see the
message and its author.

Adding graffiti to a room that does not already have graffiti costs two
trivia points and is done via 'graffiti add <message>'.  Only one message 
may exist in a room at one time.

To remove existing graffiti in a room, type 'graffiti clear'.  This costs
4 trivia points.  Alternatively, a clan leader may use the clan account to
remove graffiti in their own clan hall.  This costs 300 quest points from
the clan account. Permanent graffiti cannot be removed via 'graffiti clear'
but costs 6 trivia points to add.

Graffiti that is over a year old becomes permanent and cannot be removed.
This does not apply to clan halls using the 'clanpays' option.  If you
feel that there is a special exception, contact an imm to have the graffiti
removed manually.


Please do not leave graffiti with swearing and/or direct personal attacks 
on other characters in the game. At the very least, it will simply be 
cleared and you will have wasted your trivia points.

Note: Please report to immortal staff if you find offensive graffiti
in any language (with translation if not English).
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

[*Daily Blessing*] 460/1092 HP  1305/1495 MP  1238/1322 mv  900tnl  
Lv 51  G 329243 | Pandemonium Marketplace (NESW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 


You can no longer sense anger.

w
w
Deception Boulevard
  Traffic picks up quite a bit on this broad avenue.  Demons and Damned
alike move purposefully on their way to and from the market and Pandemonium
City's most popular tavern.  The biggest danger here is usually the
pickpockets that work the crowds.  Those who dare to leave trash here run
the risk of annoying the City Guards, so the road tends to be clear of
debris.  Somehow even the air seems cleaner, though the odor of sulphur is
never eliminated completely.  

[ Exits: north east west ]
A Damned soul slinks along warily.

n
The Twisting Gates
  Set safely away from the chasm is a pair of gates towering even over the
tallest demon.  One might guess they're made of some metal, to judge from
the rust, except that metal doesn't normally twist and bend as if in pain. 
They must be the source of the low moans filtering through the hot air.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]

>>   *[NOEXP]* Avenue of Greed
  Definitely a better neighborhood, this short avenue is lined with tall
buildings of both the residential and commercial type.  Damned aren't quite
as prevalent here, and those that do wander down the street tend to slink,
hoping to avoid attracting attention.  Of course, the demons continue to
strut proudly.  It's here that the ground is no longer as treacherous
underfoot, and actually well-maintained, if oddly soft, brick.

w
The Iron Maiden (G)
  A high class establishment, the Iron Maiden is -the- place to be seen for
aspiring demons.  Nobles frequent the place, and often reserve it for their
private parties.  Damned servants scurry to serve the patrons, and woe
betide one that drops a drink.  They usually end up on the menu.  It tends
to lend an even darker atmosphere to the dimly lit club, as they move among
clusters of tables and dodge those dancing to the wailing, discordant music.

[ Exits: east ]
Lord Mulciber relaxes, drinking a cup of the finest blackwine.

Avenue of Greed
  Definitely a better neighborhood, this short avenue is lined with tall
buildings of both the residential and commercial type.  Damned aren't quite
as prevalent here, and those that do wander down the street tend to slink,
hoping to avoid attracting attention.  Of course, the demons continue to
strut proudly.  It's here that the ground is no longer as treacherous
underfoot, and actually well-maintained, if oddly soft, brick.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]

s
Malice Bridge
  Crossing a vast chasm several miles across, this bridge is wide enough
for an army to march across without crowding.  Carved from the very stone
thrusting out from the ground, it needs no extraneous support structure. 
Still, a look over the side into the bottomless canyon below is enough to
induce vertigo and fervent hopes for the span's continued stability.  

[ Exits: north south down ]
A Damned soul slinks along warily.

Blood Alley
  It's along this alley that the majority of the city's citizens live. 
It's a narrow alley, and nobody seems to care that trash chokes it now and
then.  The stench is largely ignored in favor of making sure one stays
alive.  For this is one of the favorite haunts for muggers and those looking
to spill a little blood just for fun, and every being that walks through is
careful to keep a weapon close at hand.

w
Blood Alley
  It's along this alley that the majority of the city's citizens live. 
It's a narrow alley, and nobody seems to care that trash chokes it now and
then.  The stench is largely ignored in favor of making sure one stays
alive.  For this is one of the favorite haunts for muggers and those looking
to spill a little blood just for fun, and every being that walks through is
careful to keep a weapon close at hand.  

[ Exits: east west ]
A soldier of Nephelus glares coldly at you.
A soldier of Nephelus glares coldly at you.

Blood Alley
  It's along this alley that the majority of the city's citizens live,
though in this portion there's a noticeable upgrade in building maintenance.
The alley widens a bit here, and the number of ambushes drops dramatically. 
The sound of shouts and clashing weapons drifts into the alley through the
archway to the north.  

[ Exits: north south ]

[*Daily Blessing*] 467/1092 HP  1270/1495 MP  1316/1322 mv  910tnl  
Lv 51  G 329243 | Blood Alley (NS)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
n
The Arena [**> PK <**]
  The arena is quite long, giving anybody who wants to practice their
combat skills plenty of room.  Demons who bear allegiance to no Prince, the
gladiators owned by the city, and even Damned are welcome here.  There's
even practice weapons of all types provided.  Of course, there's a downside
to all this generosity- fight /too/ well, and one might find themselves
forced into death combat for the entertainment of the masses.  Still, that
doesn't keep would-be warriors from flocking to the Arena, and the sounds of
combat never die away.  

[ Exits: east south ]
A practicing demon tries to make himself worthy of employment.
A gladiator intently practices the fine art of combat.
A gladiator intently practices the fine art of combat.

>>   *[NOEXP]* The Twisting Gates
  Set safely away from the chasm is a pair of gates towering even over the
tallest demon.  One might guess they're made of some metal, to judge from
the rust, except that metal doesn't normally twist and bend as if in pain. 
They must be the source of the low moans filtering through the hot air.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A City Guard stands proudly at his post.
A City Guard stands proudly at his post.

[*Daily Blessing*] 467/1092 HP  1270/1495 MP  1309/1322 mv  910tnl  
Lv 51  G 329243 | The Twisting Gates (NESW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* Deception Boulevard
  Traffic picks up quite a bit on this broad avenue.  Demons and Damned
alike move purposefully on their way to and from the market and Pandemonium
City's most popular tavern.  The biggest danger here is usually the
pickpockets that work the crowds.  Those who dare to leave trash here run
the risk of annoying the City Guards, so the road tends to be clear of
debris. Somehow even the air seems cleaner, though the odor of sulphur
is never eliminated completely.  

[ Exits: east west ]

[*Daily Blessing*] 467/1092 HP  1270/1495 MP  1308/1322 mv  910tnl

n
The Twisting Gates
  Set safely away from the chasm is a pair of gates towering even over the
tallest demon.  One might guess they're made of some metal, to judge from
the rust, except that metal doesn't normally twist and bend as if in pain. 
They must be the source of the low moans filtering through the hot air.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A City Guard stands proudly at his post.
A City Guard stands proudly at his post.

[*Daily Blessing*] 467/1092 HP  1270/1495 MP  1307/1322 mv  910tnl  
Lv 51  G 329243 | The Twisting Gates (NESW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* Avenue of Greed
  Definitely a better neighborhood, this short avenue is lined with tall
buildings of both the residential and commercial type.  Damned aren't quite
as prevalent here, and those that do wander down the street tend to slink,
hoping to avoid attracting attention.  Of course, the demons continue to
strut proudly.  It's here that the ground is no longer as treacherous
underfoot, and actually well-maintained, if oddly soft, brick.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A Damned soul slinks along warily.

n
The Plaza Gates
  Almost as formidable as the gates at the City's entrance, these protect
Pandemonium's nobility from invasion of their elite sanctum.  The road
slopes upward sharply, as if discouraging would-be treaders, and the City
Guard stationed at the gate itself looks none too friendly.

Avenue of Greed
  Definitely a better neighborhood, this short avenue is lined with tall
buildings of both the residential and commercial type.  Damned aren't quite
as prevalent here, and those that do wander down the street tend to slink,
hoping to avoid attracting attention.  Of course, the demons continue to
strut proudly.  It's here that the ground is no longer as treacherous
underfoot, and actually well-maintained, if oddly soft, brick.

e
The Cathedral
  Planed wooden floors.  Pews.  An altar.  Stained glass windows. 
Everything a cathedral should be, even if this is an odd place to find one. 
But the Church of Free Will is strong in the city, despite the strange fact
that a Damned leads it.  There are those who whisper and mutter about it,
but never where they can be overheard.  

[ Exits: west ]
The Pontiff of the Church of Free Will welcomes you.

w
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
The Iron Maiden (G)
  A high class establishment, the Iron Maiden is -the- place to be seen for
aspiring demons.  Nobles frequent the place, and often reserve it for their
private parties.  Damned servants scurry to serve the patrons, and woe
betide one that drops a drink.  They usually end up on the menu.  It tends
to lend an even darker atmosphere to the dimly lit club, as they move among
clusters of tables and dodge those dancing to the wailing, discordant music.

[ Exits: east ]
A Damned soul slinks along warily.
Lord Mulciber relaxes, drinking a cup of the finest blackwine.

strut proudly.  It's here that the ground is no longer as treacherous
underfoot, and actually well-maintained, if oddly soft, brick.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A Damned soul slinks along warily.

[*Daily Blessing*] 543/1092 HP  1371/1495 MP  1322/1322 mv  910tnl  
Lv 51  G 329243 | Avenue of Greed (NESW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* The Twisting Gates
  Set safely away from the chasm is a pair of gates towering even over the
tallest demon.  One might guess they're made of some metal, to judge from
the rust, except that metal doesn't normally twist and bend as if in pain. 
They must be the source of the low moans filtering through the hot air.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A City Guard stands proudly at his post.
A City Guard stands proudly at his post.

[*Daily Blessing*] 543/1092 HP  1371/1495 MP  1321/1322 mv  910tnl  
Lv 51  G 329243 | The Twisting Gates (NESW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
s
Malice Bridge
  Crossing a vast chasm several miles across, this bridge is wide enough
for an army to march across without crowding.  Carved from the very stone
thrusting out from the ground, it needs no extraneous support structure. 
Still, a look over the side into the bottomless canyon below is enough to
induce vertigo and fervent hopes for the span's continued stability.  

[ Exits: north south down ]
A Damned soul slinks along warily.

[*Daily Blessing*] 543/1092 HP  1371/1495 MP  1320/1322 mv  910tnl  
Lv 51  G 329243 | Malice Bridge (NSD)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
d
The Bottomless Chasm (G)
  There's literally no end to this chasm.  A falling being will never hit
bottom- kind of a mixed blessing- and the canyon continues in a perfect
circle around Pandemonium City.  Even those who can fly have trouble here,
battered and tossed about by stinking, gale force winds.  Were it not for
the bridge above, the City would be almost impossible to reach.  

[ Exits: up ]

>>   *[NOEXP]* 
s
The Warren
  Red dust blown by winds of almost unbearable heat turns everything, even
the very air, the color of dried blood.  Where it comes from, nobody knows,
for the ground has been packed into stony hardness broken by dark cracks. 
This is the Warren- a sprawling collection of ramshackle hovels stretching
as far as the eye can see.  The stench of sulfur hangs heavy in the air. 
Not a pleasant place to live.  

[ Exits: north east west up ]
(Hidden) A Damned soul slinks along warily.

u
A Barren Wasteland
  All you can see, stretching far into the horizon, is a barren wasteland. 
The ground has been leeched of moisture, and is hard as rock underfoot,
laced with infinite cracks.  There's a few stunted trees, but they're
twisted and charred and lack any greenery.  The only anomaly is a narrow
hole in the ground.

Underground Haven
  A place of relative safety?  Perhaps.  Certainly there's less tension in
the air here, and laughter can actually be detected.  It's a fairly
decent-sized cave, and some effort has been made to provide a measure of
comfort.  Rickety chairs, a few tables, and even piles of blankets are
available for those able to escape the Warren for at least a few minutes.

e
Deception Boulevard
  Traffic picks up quite a bit on this broad avenue.  Demons and Damned
alike move purposefully on their way to and from the market and Pandemonium
City's most popular tavern.  The biggest danger here is usually the
pickpockets that work the crowds.  Those who dare to leave trash here run
the risk of annoying the City Guards, so the road tends to be clear of
debris. Somehow even the air seems cleaner, though the odor of sulphur
is never eliminated completely.  

[ Exits: east west ]

## You are now sober.

n
M'mog's Tavern [**> PK <**]
  Raucous laughter spills from this dimly lit tavern into the street
outside.  There's no proper door leading into the place, just a hole in the
wall, and those entering are neatly framed against the crimson light
outside.  A number of tables are available, all frozen and molded in various
entertaining shapes from hapless Damned.  Demons are allowed on the
furniture.  Damned have to be content with occupying a mucky pit in the
corner.  Business is good, and M'mog has hired a number of imps to serve his
customers.  The patrons tend to treat the staff well, lest their drinks
be...  altered.  

[ Exits: south ]
A Damned soul slinks along warily.
(Hidden) A Damned soul slinks along warily.

An imp flutters about on its tiny wings, serving drinks.

An imp flutters about on its tiny wings, serving drinks.
M'mog stands with folded arms, coolly watching his staff serve drinks.

>>   *[NOEXP]* 
Pandemonium Marketplace
  Easily the busiest place in the city, the Pandemonium Marketplace is a
broad square of flagstone easily covering half an acre.  Not only shops are
available here, but kiosks can be, and are, set up as well.  Every item
imaginable is available here, and at all hours of the day and night.  The
buzz of deals being struck can be constantly heard, interspersed with a
shout now and then as those dickering get a bit excited.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A Damned soul slinks along warily.

[*Daily Blessing*] 667/1092 HP  1495/1495 MP  1319/1322 mv  910tnl  
Lv 51  G 329243 | Pandemonium Marketplace (NESW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
op n
n

[*Daily Blessing*] 667/1092 HP  1495/1495 MP  1319/1322 mv  910tnl  
Lv 51  G 329243 | Pandemonium Marketplace (NESW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* The Grand Garbage Dump of Pandemonium City
  Eeeeewwwww!  The most horrid, overwhelming stench fills your nostrils and
invades your throat as you step *PLOP* into a mucky ooze.  The nasty stuff
is much deeper than any creature's height, and sucks you down as if you were
a tasty treat.  Perhaps you are.  There is a growling coming from deep in
the mire...  maybe it's just your imagination.  Maybe.  

[ Exits: south ]

Lv 51  G 329243 | The Grand Garbage Dump of Pandemonium City (S)

[*Daily Blessing*] 667/1092 HP  1495/1495 MP  1318/1322 mv  910tnl  
Lv 51  G 329243 | The Grand Garbage Dump of Pandemonium City (S)
w
w
>>   *[NOEXP]* Pandemonium Marketplace
  Easily the busiest place in the city, the Pandemonium Marketplace is a
broad square of flagstone easily covering half an acre.  Not only shops are
available here, but kiosks can be, and are, set up as well.  Every item
imaginable is available here, and at all hours of the day and night.  The
buzz of deals being struck can be constantly heard, interspersed with a
shout now and then as those dickering get a bit excited.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A Damned soul slinks along warily.

[*Daily Blessing*] 667/1092 HP  1495/1495 MP  1314/1322 mv  910tnl  
Lv 51  G 329243 | Pandemonium Marketplace (NESW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* Deception Boulevard
  Traffic picks up quite a bit on this broad avenue.  Demons and Damned
alike move purposefully on their way to and from the market and Pandemonium
City's most popular tavern.  The biggest danger here is usually the
pickpockets that work the crowds.  Those who dare to leave trash here run
the risk of annoying the City Guards, so the road tends to be clear of
debris.  Somehow even the air seems cleaner, though the odor of sulphur is
never eliminated completely.  

[ Exits: north east west ]
A Damned soul slinks along warily.

[*Daily Blessing*] 667/1092 HP  1495/1495 MP  1312/1322 mv  910tnl  
Lv 51  G 329243 | Deception Boulevard (EW)
w
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
The Twisting Gates
  Set safely away from the chasm is a pair of gates towering even over the
tallest demon.  One might guess they're made of some metal, to judge from
the rust, except that metal doesn't normally twist and bend as if in pain. 
They must be the source of the low moans filtering through the hot air.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A City Guard stands proudly at his post.
A City Guard stands proudly at his post.

[*Daily Blessing*] 667/1092 HP  1495/1495 MP  1311/1322 mv  910tnl  
Lv 51  G 329243 | The Twisting Gates (NESW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
s
Malice Bridge
  Crossing a vast chasm several miles across, this bridge is wide enough
for an army to march across without crowding.  Carved from the very stone
thrusting out from the ground, it needs no extraneous support structure. 
Still, a look over the side into the bottomless canyon below is enough to
induce vertigo and fervent hopes for the span's continued stability.  

[ Exits: north south down ]

>>   *[NOEXP]* Avenue of Greed
  Definitely a better neighborhood, this short avenue is lined with tall
buildings of both the residential and commercial type.  Damned aren't quite
as prevalent here, and those that do wander down the street tend to slink,
hoping to avoid attracting attention.  Of course, the demons continue to
strut proudly.  It's here that the ground is no longer as treacherous
underfoot, and actually well-maintained, if oddly soft, brick.

The Plaza Gates

e
The Cathedral
  Planed wooden floors.  Pews.  An altar.  Stained glass windows. 
Everything a cathedral should be, even if this is an odd place to find one. 
But the Church of Free Will is strong in the city, despite the strange fact
that a Damned leads it.  There are those who whisper and mutter about it,
but never where they can be overheard.  

[ Exits: west ]

>>   *[NOEXP]* 
The Iron Maiden (G)
  A high class establishment, the Iron Maiden is -the- place to be seen for
aspiring demons.  Nobles frequent the place, and often reserve it for their
private parties.  Damned servants scurry to serve the patrons, and woe
betide one that drops a drink.  They usually end up on the menu.  It tends
to lend an even darker atmosphere to the dimly lit club, as they move among
clusters of tables and dodge those dancing to the wailing, discordant music.

[ Exits: east ]
Lord Mulciber relaxes, drinking a cup of the finest blackwine.

Deception Boulevard

debris. Somehow even the air seems cleaner, though the odor of sulphur
is never eliminated completely.

M'mog's Tavern [**> PK <**]
  Raucous laughter spills from this dimly lit tavern into the street
outside.  There's no proper door leading into the place, just a hole in the
wall, and those entering are neatly framed against the crimson light
outside.  A number of tables are available, all frozen and molded in various
entertaining shapes from hapless Damned.  Demons are allowed on the
furniture.  Damned have to be content with occupying a mucky pit in the
corner.  Business is good, and M'mog has hired a number of imps to serve his
customers.  The patrons tend to treat the staff well, lest their drinks
be...  altered.

help prompt
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : Prompt Bprompt.
Help Category : Config.
Related Helps : Autolist, P, Promptflag.
Last Updated  : 2019-10-13 15:44:14.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Syntax: prompt                : Toggles prompt display.
        prompt all            : Resets prompt to hp/mana/moves/tnl format.
        prompt <variables>    : Creates custom prompt from given variables.
        bprompt <variables>   : Sets battle prompt visible while fighting.
        p data                : Show prompt data.

'prompt' with no arguments will turn your prompt on and off.  'prompt all'
will reset your prompt to the default "hp mana moves tnl" prompt.

Use 'prompt' with a combination of the following to set up a custom prompt.
For example, "prompt %hhp %mmn %vmv qt%q>" will show "10hp 10mn 10mv qt0>"
as your prompt.  Color codes ('help color') may be used in prompts; adding
@w to the beginning of your prompt can help prevent color bleeding.

You may also use 'bprompt' to set a separate battle prompt with different
data, which will show while engaged in combat.

'config' will display your current prompt and bprompt strings.  If you are
idle, your regular prompt will change to "Idle" until you return; see
'help newprompt').

Some prompt variables include additional formatting, shown in quotes.

    %h :  Current hit points       
    %H :  Maximum hit points
    %p :  Hit points, as a percentage of max ("x%")
    %m :  Current mana             
    %M :  Maximum mana
    %P :  Mana, as a percentage of max ("x%")
    %v :  Current moves            
    %V :  Maximum moves
    %N :  Moves, as a percentage of max ("x%")
    %b :  Display enemy health percentage (" Enemy: x%") - bprompt only
    %B :  Display enemy health percentage value only - bprompt only
    %x :  Total experience         
    %X :  Experience required to next level
    %E :  Current level
    %t :  Number of caught tells waiting for you
    %T :  Last character that sent you a tell ("(Reply: <name>)")
    %g :  Carried gold
    %a :  Current alignment value
    %r :  Room name - regular prompt only
    %K :  Displays [**> PK <**] when in a PK-flagged room.
    %e :  Open room exits ("NESWUD") - regular prompt only
    %q :  Time remaining on current quest or until next quest
    %d :  Minutes of double experience remaining (" Dbl: x")
    %f :  Poker hand information, if participating in a game
    %i :  Shows whether current room is considered inside / outside.

    %c :  Inserts a carriage return (useful for multi-line prompts)
    %% :  Display a % sign in the prompt.

    The following display only when the group leader is in combat:
    %l :  Group leader's hit points (" Ldr: x")
    %L :  Group leader hit point percentage (" Ldr: x%")
        
    The following display only when the person you are following
    is in combat:
    %o : HP of person you are following.
    %O : HP percent of person you are following.

    Immortal-only variables:
    %R :  Room key
    %z :  Area name
    %W :  Wizi level
    %I :  Incog (rinvis) level
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

[*Daily Blessing*] 1001/1092 HP  1054/1495 MP  1223/1322 mv  910tnl

p data

Regular Game Prompt    : %h/%H HP  %m/%M MP  %v/%V mv  %Xtnl %T%cLv %E  G %g | %r (%e)%c%K>>   
Rawcolor Game Prompt   : @G%h@g/%H HP  @C%m@c/%M MP  @y%v@Y/%V mv  @M%X@mtnl @c%T%c@wLv %E  @WG %g@w
| %r (%e)@w%c%K>>  @w @w

Regular Battle Prompt  : FIGHTING!%c%h/%H HP  %m/%M MP  %v/%V mv  %Xtnl%c%p HP (you) | %b HP (mob)%K
>>   
Rawcolor Battle Prompt : @RFIGHTING!%c@G%h@g/%H HP  @C%m@c/%M MP  @y%v@Y/%V mv  @M%X@mtnl%c@w@C%p HP
(you) | %b HP (mob)@w%K >>  @w @w

Lv 51  G 329243 | Blood Alley (EW)
>>    *[NOEXP]* 
w
Blood Alley
  It's along this alley that the majority of the city's citizens live. 
It's a narrow alley, and nobody seems to care that trash chokes it now and
then.  The stench is largely ignored in favor of making sure one stays
alive.  For this is one of the favorite haunts for muggers and those looking
to spill a little blood just for fun, and every being that walks through is
careful to keep a weapon close at hand.  

[ Exits: east west ]
A soldier of Nephelus glares coldly at you.

Blood Alley
  It's along this alley that the majority of the city's citizens live,
though in this portion there's a noticeable upgrade in building maintenance.
The alley widens a bit here, and the number of ambushes drops dramatically. 
The sound of shouts and clashing weapons drifts into the alley through the
archway to the north.

[*Daily Blessing*] 1092/1092 HP  1339/1495 MP  1317/1322 mv  910tnl  
Lv 51  G 329243 | Blood Alley (NS)
>>    *[NOEXP]* 
n
The Arena [**> PK <**]
  The arena is quite long, giving anybody who wants to practice their
combat skills plenty of room.  Demons who bear allegiance to no Prince, the
gladiators owned by the city, and even Damned are welcome here.  There's
even practice weapons of all types provided.  Of course, there's a downside
to all this generosity- fight /too/ well, and one might find themselves
forced into death combat for the entertainment of the masses.  Still, that
doesn't keep would-be warriors from flocking to the Arena, and the sounds of
combat never die away.  

[ Exits: east south ]
A gladiator intently practices the fine art of combat.
A practicing demon tries to make himself worthy of employment.

e
The Twisting Gates
  Set safely away from the chasm is a pair of gates towering even over the
tallest demon.  One might guess they're made of some metal, to judge from
the rust, except that metal doesn't normally twist and bend as if in pain. 
They must be the source of the low moans filtering through the hot air.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A City Guard stands proudly at his post.
A City Guard stands proudly at his post.

[*Daily Blessing*] 1092/1092 HP  1339/1495 MP  1310/1322 mv  910tnl

n
>>    *[NOEXP]* 
Avenue of Greed
  Definitely a better neighborhood, this short avenue is lined with tall
buildings of both the residential and commercial type.  Damned aren't quite
as prevalent here, and those that do wander down the street tend to slink,
hoping to avoid attracting attention.  Of course, the demons continue to
strut proudly.  It's here that the ground is no longer as treacherous
underfoot, and actually well-maintained, if oddly soft, brick.

n
The Plaza Gates
  Almost as formidable as the gates at the City's entrance, these protect
Pandemonium's nobility from invasion of their elite sanctum.  The road
slopes upward sharply, as if discouraging would-be treaders, and the City
Guard stationed at the gate itself looks none too friendly.

w
>>    *[NOEXP]* 
The Iron Maiden (G)
  A high class establishment, the Iron Maiden is -the- place to be seen for
aspiring demons.  Nobles frequent the place, and often reserve it for their
private parties.  Damned servants scurry to serve the patrons, and woe
betide one that drops a drink.  They usually end up on the menu.  It tends
to lend an even darker atmosphere to the dimly lit club, as they move among
clusters of tables and dodge those dancing to the wailing, discordant music.

[ Exits: east ]
A soldier in the Crystal Guard admires her reflection in a mirror.

>>    *[NOEXP]* Deception Boulevard
  Traffic picks up quite a bit on this broad avenue.  Demons and Damned
alike move purposefully on their way to and from the market and Pandemonium
City's most popular tavern.  The biggest danger here is usually the
pickpockets that work the crowds.  Those who dare to leave trash here run
the risk of annoying the City Guards, so the road tends to be clear of
debris. Somehow even the air seems cleaner, though the odor of sulphur
is never eliminated completely.  

[ Exits: east west ]
A Damned soul slinks along warily.

Lv 51  G 329243 | Deception Boulevard (NEW)
n
>>    *[NOEXP]* 
M'mog's Tavern [**> PK <**]
  Raucous laughter spills from this dimly lit tavern into the street
outside.  There's no proper door leading into the place, just a hole in the
wall, and those entering are neatly framed against the crimson light
outside.  A number of tables are available, all frozen and molded in various
entertaining shapes from hapless Damned.  Demons are allowed on the
furniture.  Damned have to be content with occupying a mucky pit in the
corner.  Business is good, and M'mog has hired a number of imps to serve his
customers.  The patrons tend to treat the staff well, lest their drinks
be...  altered.  

[ Exits: south ]
An imp flutters about on its tiny wings, serving drinks.
A Damned soul slinks along warily.
(Hidden) A Damned soul slinks along warily.
A City Guard relaxes at a table, enjoying his off-duty hours.
An imp flutters about on its tiny wings, serving drinks.

M'mog stands with folded arms, coolly watching his staff serve drinks.

Deception Boulevard
  Traffic picks up quite a bit on this broad avenue.  Demons and Damned
alike move purposefully on their way to and from the market and Pandemonium
City's most popular tavern.  The biggest danger here is usually the
pickpockets that work the crowds.  Those who dare to leave trash here run
the risk of annoying the City Guards, so the road tends to be clear of
debris.  Somehow even the air seems cleaner, though the odor of sulphur is
never eliminated completely.

[*Daily Blessing*] 1092/1092 HP  1420/1495 MP  1322/1322 mv  910tnl  
Lv 51  G 329243 | Deception Boulevard (NEW)
e
>>    *[NOEXP]* Pandemonium Marketplace
  Easily the busiest place in the city, the Pandemonium Marketplace is a
broad square of flagstone easily covering half an acre.  Not only shops are
available here, but kiosks can be, and are, set up as well.  Every item
imaginable is available here, and at all hours of the day and night.  The
buzz of deals being struck can be constantly heard, interspersed with a
shout now and then as those dickering get a bit excited.  

[ Exits: (north) east south west ]

[*Daily Blessing*] 1092/1092 HP  1420/1495 MP  1321/1322 mv  910tnl

Lv 51  G 329243 | The Twisting Gates (NESW)
s
>>    *[NOEXP]* 
Malice Bridge
  Crossing a vast chasm several miles across, this bridge is wide enough
for an army to march across without crowding.  Carved from the very stone
thrusting out from the ground, it needs no extraneous support structure. 
Still, a look over the side into the bottomless canyon below is enough to
induce vertigo and fervent hopes for the span's continued stability.  

[ Exits: north south down ]
A Damned soul slinks along warily.
A Damned soul slinks along warily.

[*Daily Blessing*] 1092/1092 HP  1420/1495 MP  1317/1322 mv  910tnl  
Lv 51  G 329243 | Malice Bridge (NSD)
>>    *[NOEXP]* 
d
The Bottomless Chasm (G)
  There's literally no end to this chasm.  A falling being will never hit
bottom- kind of a mixed blessing- and the canyon continues in a perfect
circle around Pandemonium City.  Even those who can fly have trouble here,
battered and tossed about by stinking, gale force winds.  Were it not for
the bridge above, the City would be almost impossible to reach.  

[ Exits: up ]

[*Daily Blessing*] 1092/1092 HP  1420/1495 MP  1314/1322 mv  910tnl  
Lv 51  G 329243 | The Bottomless Chasm (U)
>>    *[NOEXP]* 
u
Malice Bridge
  Crossing a vast chasm several miles across, this bridge is wide enough
for an army to march across without crowding.  Carved from the very stone
thrusting out from the ground, it needs no extraneous support structure. 
Still, a look over the side into the bottomless canyon below is enough to
induce vertigo and fervent hopes for the span's continued stability.  

[ Exits: north south down ]
A Damned soul slinks along warily.
A Damned soul slinks along warily.

[*Daily Blessing*] 1092/1092 HP  1420/1495 MP  1309/1322 mv  910tnl  
Lv 51  G 329243 | Malice Bridge (NSD)
s
>>    *[NOEXP]* 
The Warren
  Red dust blown by winds of almost unbearable heat turns everything, even
the very air, the color of dried blood.  Where it comes from, nobody knows,
for the ground has been packed into stony hardness broken by dark cracks. 
This is the Warren- a sprawling collection of ramshackle hovels stretching
as far as the eye can see.  The stench of sulfur hangs heavy in the air. 
Not a pleasant place to live.  

[ Exits: north east west up ]
A Damned soul slinks along warily.

[*Daily Blessing*] 1092/1092 HP  1420/1495 MP  1306/1322 mv  910tnl  
Lv 51  G 329243 | The Warren (NEWU)
u
>>    *[NOEXP]* 
A Barren Wasteland
  All you can see, stretching far into the horizon, is a barren wasteland. 
The ground has been leeched of moisture, and is hard as rock underfoot,
laced with infinite cracks.  There's a few stunted trees, but they're
twisted and charred and lack any greenery.  The only anomaly is a narrow
hole in the ground.  

[ Exits: east down ]

>>    *[NOEXP]* 
Underground Haven
  A place of relative safety?  Perhaps.  Certainly there's less tension in
the air here, and laughter can actually be detected.  It's a fairly
decent-sized cave, and some effort has been made to provide a measure of
comfort.  Rickety chairs, a few tables, and even piles of blankets are
available for those able to escape the Warren for at least a few minutes.

Lv 51  G 329243 | Malice Bridge (NSD)
d
>>    *[NOEXP]* 


The Bottomless Chasm (G)
  There's literally no end to this chasm.  A falling being will never hit
bottom- kind of a mixed blessing- and the canyon continues in a perfect
circle around Pandemonium City.  Even those who can fly have trouble here,
battered and tossed about by stinking, gale force winds.  Were it not for
the bridge above, the City would be almost impossible to reach.  

[ Exits: up ]

n
The Twisting Gates
  Set safely away from the chasm is a pair of gates towering even over the
tallest demon.  One might guess they're made of some metal, to judge from
the rust, except that metal doesn't normally twist and bend as if in pain. 
They must be the source of the low moans filtering through the hot air.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A City Guard stands proudly at his post.
A City Guard stands proudly at his post.

[*Daily Blessing*] 1092/1092 HP  1464/1495 MP  1311/1322 mv  910tnl  
Lv 51  G 329243 | The Twisting Gates (NESW)
>>    *[NOEXP]* 
n
Avenue of Greed
  Definitely a better neighborhood, this short avenue is lined with tall
buildings of both the residential and commercial type.  Damned aren't quite
as prevalent here, and those that do wander down the street tend to slink,
hoping to avoid attracting attention.  Of course, the demons continue to
strut proudly.  It's here that the ground is no longer as treacherous
underfoot, and actually well-maintained, if oddly soft, brick.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]

n
The Plaza Gates
  Almost as formidable as the gates at the City's entrance, these protect
Pandemonium's nobility from invasion of their elite sanctum.  The road
slopes upward sharply, as if discouraging would-be treaders, and the City
Guard stationed at the gate itself looks none too friendly.

e
The Cathedral
  Planed wooden floors.  Pews.  An altar.  Stained glass windows. 
Everything a cathedral should be, even if this is an odd place to find one. 
But the Church of Free Will is strong in the city, despite the strange fact
that a Damned leads it.  There are those who whisper and mutter about it,
but never where they can be overheard.

Lv 51  G 329243 | The Twisting Gates (NESW)
>>    *[NOEXP]* 
e
Deception Boulevard
  Traffic picks up quite a bit on this broad avenue.  Demons and Damned
alike move purposefully on their way to and from the market and Pandemonium
City's most popular tavern.  The biggest danger here is usually the
pickpockets that work the crowds.  Those who dare to leave trash here run
the risk of annoying the City Guards, so the road tends to be clear of
debris. Somehow even the air seems cleaner, though the odor of sulphur
is never eliminated completely.  

[ Exits: east west ]
A Damned soul slinks along warily.

n
M'mog's Tavern [**> PK <**]
  Raucous laughter spills from this dimly lit tavern into the street
outside.  There's no proper door leading into the place, just a hole in the
wall, and those entering are neatly framed against the crimson light
outside.  A number of tables are available, all frozen and molded in various
entertaining shapes from hapless Damned.  Demons are allowed on the
furniture.  Damned have to be content with occupying a mucky pit in the
corner.  Business is good, and M'mog has hired a number of imps to serve his
customers.  The patrons tend to treat the staff well, lest their drinks
be...  altered.  

[ Exits: south ]
An imp flutters about on its tiny wings, serving drinks.
A Damned soul slinks along warily.
A City Guard relaxes at a table, enjoying his off-duty hours.
An imp flutters about on its tiny wings, serving drinks.

An imp flutters about on its tiny wings, serving drinks.
M'mog stands with folded arms, coolly watching his staff serve drinks.

[*Daily Blessing*] 1092/1092 HP  1495/1495 MP  1317/1322 mv  910tnl  
Lv 51  G 329243 | Deception Boulevard (NEW)
>>    *[NOEXP]* Pandemonium Marketplace
  Easily the busiest place in the city, the Pandemonium Marketplace is a
broad square of flagstone easily covering half an acre.  Not only shops are
available here, but kiosks can be, and are, set up as well.  Every item
imaginable is available here, and at all hours of the day and night.  The
buzz of deals being struck can be constantly heard, interspersed with a
shout now and then as those dickering get a bit excited.  

[ Exits: (north) east south west ]

The Rialto
  The Rialto is a general store, selling a little bit of everything.  Need
some travel rations for that long journey?  This is the place to acquire
them.  Or how about a wilted flower for that special someone?  A cloak to
hide your lovely features while you assassinate that demon lord?  Got one,
right here.  Feel free to browse, but if you break it, you buy it.  And that
includes the staff.

The Warren
  Red dust blown by winds of almost unbearable heat turns everything, even
the very air, the color of dried blood.  Where it comes from, nobody knows,
for the ground has been packed into stony hardness broken by dark cracks. 
This is the Warren- a sprawling collection of ramshackle hovels stretching
as far as the eye can see.  The stench of sulfur hangs heavy in the air. 
Not a pleasant place to live.  

[ Exits: north east west up ]
A Damned soul slinks along warily.

[*Daily Blessing*] 1017/1092 HP  1322/1495 MP  1233/1322 mv  910tnl  
Lv 51  G 329243 | The Warren (NEWU)

The Warren
  Red dust blown by winds of almost unbearable heat turns everything, even
the very air, the color of dried blood. Where it comes from, nobody knows,
for the ground has been packed into stony hardness broken by dark cracks.
This is the Warren- a sprawling collection of ramshackle hovels stretching
as far as the eye can see. The stench of sulfur hangs heavy in the air,
and gleaming eyes show from behind loose boards and piles of rubble.
Not a pleasant place to live.

The Warren

[*Daily Blessing*] 1069/1092 HP  1389/1495 MP  1319/1322 mv  910tnl  
Lv 51  G 329243 | The Warren (NEWU)
>>    *[NOEXP]* Malice Bridge
  Crossing a vast chasm several miles across, this bridge is wide enough
for an army to march across without crowding.  Carved from the very stone
thrusting out from the ground, it needs no extraneous support structure. 
Still, a look over the side into the bottomless canyon below is enough to
induce vertigo and fervent hopes for the span's continued stability.  

[ Exits: north south down ]
A Damned soul slinks along warily.
A Damned soul slinks along warily.

[*Daily Blessing*] 1069/1092 HP  1389/1495 MP  1316/1322 mv  910tnl  
Lv 51  G 329243 | Malice Bridge (NSD)
>>    *[NOEXP]* 
n
e
The Twisting Gates
  Set safely away from the chasm is a pair of gates towering even over the
tallest demon.  One might guess they're made of some metal, to judge from
the rust, except that metal doesn't normally twist and bend as if in pain. 
They must be the source of the low moans filtering through the hot air.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A City Guard stands proudly at his post.
A City Guard stands proudly at his post.

[*Daily Blessing*] 1069/1092 HP  1389/1495 MP  1313/1322 mv  910tnl  
Lv 51  G 329243 | The Twisting Gates (NESW)
>>    *[NOEXP]* Deception Boulevard
  Traffic picks up quite a bit on this broad avenue.  Demons and Damned
alike move purposefully on their way to and from the market and Pandemonium
City's most popular tavern.  The biggest danger here is usually the
pickpockets that work the crowds.  Those who dare to leave trash here run
the risk of annoying the City Guards, so the road tends to be clear of
debris. Somehow even the air seems cleaner, though the odor of sulphur
is never eliminated completely.  

[ Exits: east west ]
A Damned soul slinks along warily.

You can no longer avoid some attacks.

n
Avenue of Greed
  Definitely a better neighborhood, this short avenue is lined with tall
buildings of both the residential and commercial type.  Damned aren't quite
as prevalent here, and those that do wander down the street tend to slink,
hoping to avoid attracting attention.  Of course, the demons continue to
strut proudly.  It's here that the ground is no longer as treacherous
underfoot, and actually well-maintained, if oddly soft, brick.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A Damned soul slinks along warily.
A Damned soul slinks along warily.

[*Daily Blessing*] 1069/1092 HP  1389/1495 MP  1308/1322 mv  910tnl

>>    *[NOEXP]* 
n
The Plaza Gates
  Almost as formidable as the gates at the City's entrance, these protect
Pandemonium's nobility from invasion of their elite sanctum.  The road
slopes upward sharply, as if discouraging would-be treaders, and the City
Guard stationed at the gate itself looks none too friendly.  

[ Exits: north south ]
A City Guard stands proudly at his post.
The guard posted here glares at you suspiciously.
A City Guard exclaims, "You'd better have a pass if you're thinking of
 entering the Royal Plaza, mortal!"

help note
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : Notes.
Help Category : Communication.
Related Helps : Forum, Note Editor, Note Writing, Note Reading, Note Editor, Notify, Board,
Subscribe.
Last Updated  : 2021-09-04 21:40:44.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Notes are created by players to communicate on Aardwolf's longer-term forum/
communication system. There are several forums/boards, each with specific
topics. The help files that deal with note reading and writing are listed
below.

Syntax: help note writing         : Display help on composing a note.
        help note reading         : Display help on reading a note.
        help note editor          : Display help on the note editor.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

w
Garien's Hideaway
  Definitely not much to look at, this one-room shack is nonetheless
typical of the dwellings squabbled over in the Warren.  With a roof so low
one has to duck to enter, and only some ragged blankets to provide comfort,
it does have one precious advantage- it's a place to hide from those that
would do its occupant harm.  And there are many, many of those.  

[ Exits: east ]
A Damned soul slinks along warily.
A Damned soul slinks along warily.
A Damned soul slinks along warily.
Garien stands with crossed arms, appraising you.

[*Daily Blessing*] 1092/1092 HP  1495/1495 MP  1311/1322 mv  910tnl  
Lv 51  G 329043 | The Plaza Gates (NS)
>>    *[NOEXP]* 
n
The Royal Plaza
  The peak of the city, in more ways than one.  Grand palaces sprawl in all
directions, each the home of a demon Prince.  Entering those residences
without invitation is probably a bad idea, and this is emphasized by the
soldiers that almost outnumber the crowds of demons moving through the long
plaza.  The bricks lining the ground are perfect, with no chinks or cracks. 
The only exception is the occasional bloodstain, usually the only thing left
of Damned that enter the plaza without a pass signed by a Prince.  Luckily,
the stains wash away easily.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A City Guard stands proudly at his post.
A City Guard stands proudly at his post.
A City Guard stands proudly at his post.
A City Guard stands proudly at his post.
(White Aura) A sympathetic demon gives you a sly, friendly smile.

(White Aura) A sympathetic demon gives you a sly, friendly smile.
