Lv 51  G 329043 | The Royal Plaza (NESW)
>>    *[NOEXP]* 


n
The Royal Plaza
  The peak of the city, in more ways than one.  Grand palaces sprawl in all
directions, each the home of a demon Prince.  Entering those residences
without invitation is probably a bad idea, and this is emphasized by the
soldiers that almost outnumber the crowds of demons moving through the long
plaza.  To the north is the grandest castle of all- that owned by the King
himself, and from which he administers the land.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A City Guard stands proudly at his post.
A City Guard stands proudly at his post.

[*Daily Blessing*] 1092/1092 HP  1495/1495 MP  1321/1322 mv  910tnl  
Lv 51  G 329043 | The Royal Plaza (NESW)
n
>>    *[NOEXP]* 
The Court of the King
  Oddly, perhaps, this is the most peaceful place in all of Pandemonium. 
Unlike some courts, in which nobles and citizens alike do not hesitate to
scream out their opinions and protests, King Lucifer's is maintained with
quiet decorum.  This probably has something to do with the fact that
violators of this rule are likely to find their heads on a spike.  Even
honor combat is forbidden in this grand hall built of simple stone and wood.
The King and his Princes each have a permanent throne here, around which are
usually clustered petitioners.  Lucifer's, of course, towers over the rest,
though the statues carved of stone, each depicting one of those nobles, are
more colossal than anything most demons and Damned ever hope to see.  

[ Exits: (north) south ]
A Damned soul scurries about, carrying out its duties for its lord.
A Damned soul scurries about, carrying out its duties for its lord.
A Damned soul scurries about, carrying out its duties for its lord.
A Damned soul scurries about, carrying out its duties for its lord.

[*Daily Blessing*] 1092/1092 HP  1495/1495 MP  1320/1322 mv  910tnl  
Lv 51  G 329043 | The Court of the King (NS)
>>    *[NOEXP]* The Depths of Behemoth Castle
  Brave you are indeed, to venture so far into the home of the King.
Perhaps it's quite understandable fear that keeps most out, though not even
a single guard is posted at the stone stairs that curl their spiral way
upwards. The walls are damp and cool, and the observant might notice
rivulets of... you hope that's water, though it's rather dark... converging
and draining into the grate at the middle of the floor. It's also through
that grate that muffled screams become quite clear, sending a shiver along
listeners' spines.

[ Exits: south up (down) ]
A Damned soul scurries about, carrying out its duties for its lord.
A Damned soul scurries about, carrying out its duties for its lord.

[*Daily Blessing*] 1065/1092 HP  882/1495 MP  1313/1322 mv  910tnl  
Lv 51  G 329068 | A Cell (E)
>>    *[NOEXP]* 
help graffiti
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : Graffiti.
Help Category : Miscellaneous.
Related Helps : Look, Rlook.
Last Updated  : 2023-01-28 13:14:46.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Syntax: graffiti add <message>   Adds graffiti to a room (199 char max)
        graffiti perm <message>  Writes permanent message (can't be cleared)
        graffiti clear           Removes non-permanent graffiti
        graffiti clear clanpays  Removes clan hall graffiti (leader only)

Graffiti allows you to leave a hidden message in a room that other players
may find later.  Rooms with graffiti will have a (G) appended to the end of
the room name (e.g., 'Center Square (G)'.  Simply 'look graffiti' to see the
message and its author.

Adding graffiti to a room that does not already have graffiti costs two
trivia points and is done via 'graffiti add <message>'.  Only one message 
may exist in a room at one time.

To remove existing graffiti in a room, type 'graffiti clear'.  This costs
4 trivia points.  Alternatively, a clan leader may use the clan account to
remove graffiti in their own clan hall.  This costs 300 quest points from
the clan account. Permanent graffiti cannot be removed via 'graffiti clear'
but costs 6 trivia points to add.

Graffiti that is over a year old becomes permanent and cannot be removed.
This does not apply to clan halls using the 'clanpays' option.  If you
feel that there is a special exception, contact an imm to have the graffiti
removed manually.


Please do not leave graffiti with swearing and/or direct personal attacks 
on other characters in the game. At the very least, it will simply be 
cleared and you will have wasted your trivia points.

Note: Please report to immortal staff if you find offensive graffiti
in any language (with translation if not English).
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

[*Daily Blessing*] 1065/1092 HP  882/1495 MP  1313/1322 mv  910tnl  
Lv 51  G 329068 | A Cell (E)
>>    *[NOEXP]* 


Global Quest: Global Quest # 8610 has been won by Kers - 3412th win.
Global Quest: Global Quest # 8610 will go into extended time for 5 more minutes.

l;ex
A Cell
  Barely seven feet by seven feet in dimension, this is definitely a
punishment in and of itself.  Most demons would have to curl up to reside
within a cell like this.  Then there's the shackles that are here to twist
bodies into uncomfortable positions, preventing rest.  The room is bare,
without even a blanket to provide a measure of comfort.  Gleaming eyes and
chittering noises from behind cracked bricks speak of creatures that will
happily visit to feed once the occupant is asleep.  

[ Exits: east ]

The Dungeons of the Iron Order (G)
  It's pretty much everything one would expect from a dungeon.  A single
exit.  Instruments of torture.  The floor permanently stained dark red with
spilled blood.  The sound of screams, and begging for mercy, and the odor of
despair.  

[ Exits: east west up ]
     The rack, infamous instrument of torture, waits for its next victim.
Lord Mephistopheles makes sure the prisoner interrogations go well.

u
The Depths of Behemoth Castle
  Brave you are indeed, to venture so far into the home of the King.
Perhaps it's quite understandable fear that keeps most out, though not even
a single guard is posted at the stone stairs that curl their spiral way
upwards. The walls are damp and cool, and the observant might notice
rivulets of... you hope that's water, though it's rather dark... converging
and draining into the grate at the middle of the floor. It's also through
that grate that muffled screams become quite clear, sending a shiver along
listeners' spines.

[ Exits: south up down ]
An Iron Order agent slides a measuring, sideways glance at you.
A Damned soul scurries about, carrying out its duties for its lord.

[*Daily Blessing*] 1065/1092 HP  882/1495 MP  1307/1322 mv  910tnl

s
s
The Court of the King
  Oddly, perhaps, this is the most peaceful place in all of Pandemonium. 
Unlike some courts, in which nobles and citizens alike do not hesitate to
scream out their opinions and protests, King Lucifer's is maintained with
quiet decorum.  This probably has something to do with the fact that
violators of this rule are likely to find their heads on a spike.  Even
honor combat is forbidden in this grand hall built of simple stone and wood.
The King and his Princes each have a permanent throne here, around which are
usually clustered petitioners.  Lucifer's, of course, towers over the rest,
though the statues carved of stone, each depicting one of those nobles, are
more colossal than anything most demons and Damned ever hope to see.  

[ Exits: north south ]
A Damned soul scurries about, carrying out its duties for its lord.
A Damned soul scurries about, carrying out its duties for its lord.
A Damned soul scurries about, carrying out its duties for its lord.
A Damned soul scurries about, carrying out its duties for its lord.

>>    *[NOEXP]* The Royal Plaza
  The peak of the city, in more ways than one.  Grand palaces sprawl in all
directions, each the home of a demon Prince.  Entering those residences
without invitation is probably a bad idea, and this is emphasized by the
soldiers that almost outnumber the crowds of demons moving through the long
plaza.  To the north is the grandest castle of all- that owned by the King
himself, and from which he administers the land.

The Twisting Gates
  Set safely away from the chasm is a pair of gates towering even over the
tallest demon.  One might guess they're made of some metal, to judge from
the rust, except that metal doesn't normally twist and bend as if in pain. 
They must be the source of the low moans filtering through the hot air.

>>    *[NOEXP]* Malice Bridge
  Crossing a vast chasm several miles across, this bridge is wide enough
for an army to march across without crowding.  Carved from the very stone
thrusting out from the ground, it needs no extraneous support structure. 
Still, a look over the side into the bottomless canyon below is enough to
induce vertigo and fervent hopes for the span's continued stability.

The Warren
  Red dust blown by winds of almost unbearable heat turns everything, even
the very air, the color of dried blood.  Where it comes from, nobody knows,
for the ground has been packed into stony hardness broken by dark cracks. 
This is the Warren- a sprawling collection of ramshackle hovels stretching
as far as the eye can see.  The stench of sulfur hangs heavy in the air. 
Not a pleasant place to live.  

[ Exits: north east west up ]
A Damned soul slinks along warily.
A Damned soul slinks along warily.

>>    *[NOEXP]* The Bottomless Chasm (G)
  There's literally no end to this chasm.  A falling being will never hit
bottom- kind of a mixed blessing- and the canyon continues in a perfect
circle around Pandemonium City.  Even those who can fly have trouble here,
battered and tossed about by stinking, gale force winds.  Were it not for
the bridge above, the City would be almost impossible to reach.

d
The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

[ Exits: north east south west up down ]

w
Boot Clan Public Hall (G)
  You have wandered out of the Academy and into Boot Camps clanhall. 
Clans are a special thing on aardwolf allowing like minded people to 
come together. Read help clans for more information. Boot Camp is a 
clan designed to help new players learn more about the game and we 
enjoy doing it. Read help boot and help newbieclan to learn more. 
This area is not a part of the Academy and the first thing you should 
do on Aardwolf is complete the Academy goal. We offer newbie starter 
kits to all new players. If you would like one please send a member a 
tell. You can type who boot to see who is online. If they do not 
respond then they are most likely afk. All items in our newbie kits 
are also sold in this shop. Type list if you would like to take a look 
at them. To return to the Academy type north.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A commissary shopkeeper stands here, begging you to type 'list'.

>>    *[NOEXP]* Recreation Room (G)
  Walking into the room, you notice there is a relaxed, friendly atmosphere and
almost everyone is in military uniform. A jukebox is playing a lively tune 
and some of the patrons are having fun dancing to the music. The sound of 
laughter coming from one end of the bar, as someone has just delivered the 
punch line of a good joke. Plush, comfortable looking, couches are scattered 
around the large room in clusters of two and three, allowing for more 
intimate gatherings and private conversations. The enlisted and the officers 
mingle together amicably and everyone is on excellent terms with the 
bartender.

>>    *[NOEXP]* Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

wake
You wake up on Medical beds, then stand up.
Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

[ Exits: east (down) ]
     A refrigerated milk cooler stands ready to serve all.
     Multiple beds line the wall, waiting for people to rest or be treated on them.
     An old electric heater.
[AFK] (Player) (White Aura) Tench the Venomist is sleeping in a trivia sleeping bag.
(Player) (White Aura) (OPK) Inix the Hunter is sleeping on Medical beds.
Lieutenant Pixie smiles up at you as she gets ready to amputate your leg.

e
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

Mudpits (G)
  You stand in a training field with wet and muddy grounds.
As you continue down the fields,you realize that

ground.

an older man in a brown uniform who is as tough as
nails.

>>    *[NOEXP]* Recreation Room (G)
  Walking into the room, you notice there is a relaxed, friendly atmosphere and
almost everyone is in military uniform. A jukebox is playing a lively tune 
and some of the patrons are having fun dancing to the music. The sound of 
laughter coming from one end of the bar, as someone has just delivered the 
punch line of a good joke. Plush, comfortable looking, couches are scattered 
around the large room in clusters of two and three, allowing for more 
intimate gatherings and private conversations. The enlisted and the officers 
mingle together amicably and everyone is on excellent terms with the 
bartender.

[ Exits: east south west ]
An old veteran stands behind the bar, ready to serve you a cool drink.

>>    *[NOEXP]* Boot Clan Public Hall (G)
  You have wandered out of the Academy and into Boot Camps clanhall. 
Clans are a special thing on aardwolf allowing like minded people to 
come together. Read help clans for more information. Boot Camp is a 
clan designed to help new players learn more about the game and we 
enjoy doing it. Read help boot and help newbieclan to learn more. 
This area is not a part of the Academy and the first thing you should 
do on Aardwolf is complete the Academy goal. We offer newbie starter 
kits to all new players. If you would like one please send a member a 
tell. You can type who boot to see who is online. If they do not 
respond then they are most likely afk. All items in our newbie kits 
are also sold in this shop. Type list if you would like to take a look 
at them. To return to the Academy type north.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A commissary shopkeeper stands here, begging you to type 'list'.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.

stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)

adventurers.

A Quiet Meadow
  Soft breezes sway the long grasses invitingly.  A slight scent of seawater
drifts from the north where you can just see a rocky outcropping.  Looking
around, you are slightly puzzled.  To the best of your recollection there
was once a quaint little village here.  A well-trodden path leads north
towards the sound of waves crashing against rocks.  
 
A wooden sign sticks up from the grass.

[ Exits: north south ]
Blinking in the sunlight, a gopher peeks at you.

Overlooking a Newly Formed Sea (G)
  Gazing out, all you see is an endless expanse of water.  Far, far below
the waves crash against jagged slices of shoreline.  A thin stretch of beach
is barely visible at the base of the cliffs, and that might just be another
being standing at the water's edge.  The main path continues on right over
the cliff's edge, as if there used to be land there and a place for the path
to go.  Looking around for a possible way down, you spy a fresh trail
heading off to the east.

>>    *[NOEXP]* A Jagged Cliff's Edge (G)
  Here the winds are no longer gentle, and you struggle to maintain your

that you previously glimpsed is much clearer, and you can see that it is,
indeed, a person standing on the beach.  Taking a deep breath, you lower
yourself over the edge, determined to ask of this other what has happened
to the peaceful village that once stood here.

>>    *[NOEXP]* Halfway Down the Cliff (G)
  A shallow ledge allows you to pause to take a deep breath.  Screeching
gulls swoop overhead, cursing your intrusion of their domain.  Your
trembling fingers are torn and bleeding from scrambling for purchase on the
jagged rock.  The winds whip you mercilessly, almost sending you reeling off
of the sheer face.  Looking up, you see that to attempt to return to safer
ground is near to impossible.  Down seems to be the only option.

d
At the Base of the Cliff
  At last, you place your feet on solid ground.  Looking up, you can hardly
believe that you actually were able to make it down the cliff unscathed. 
The beach stretches out before you, inviting you to stroll along and
discover the local flora and fauna.  Everywhere you see rampant signs of
flourishing life.  Tide pools teem with small, scurrying creatures and
shells glisten in the sunlight.  All in all, it is a rather picturesque
place.  Further ahead you can make out with certainty the form of a little
green man gazing out over the waters.  Maybe now you can finally find out
what has happened here.  

[ Exits: north up ]

Wandering Along the Beach
  The warm sands cushion your steps as you wander closer to the shoreline. 
There seems to be an abundance of life everywhere...  The sands are patterned
with strange, wavering lines, as if something has crawled from the sea to
further up the beach.  All around you are misshapen lumps of sand, and to
the north a large lump seems to be attracting the attention of quite a few
of the gulls.

>>    *[NOEXP]* At the Shoreline
  Finally, you have reached the water's edge.  Here stands the man you saw

sadness.  Looking past him, you see a drop off in the shoreline.  There is a
faint luminescence in the water, almost as if a path has been outlined on
the sea's floor.  Perhaps a closer look is worthwhile.

Along the Sea Floor
  Dimly lit, this space is close and cramped.  The ceiling seems to press
down upon you.  Reaching up, you feel something odd.  It is a smooth surface,
with what might be a clasp or lock of some kind.  Peering through the murky
darkness, you realize that this is another house, again strangely intact. 
However, whatever force brought this house here hasn't left it unscathed. 
It is actually upside down, lodged between two rocks!  Perhaps you can
explore it further by opening what just might be a window over your head.

Along the Sea Floor
  Following the lit path, you finally seem to be getting somewhere.  To the
north the glow intensifies, and the creatures here are almost frantic in
their movements.  A brutally cold current draws you along, sweeping you
towards the brilliance just in view.  Be brave; see what wonders may await
you.

A Strangely Glowing Rock
  Here, the dim light that has guided your path coalesces into one
brilliant pinpoint.  The entire area seems to almost throb with otherworldly
phosphorescence.  Looking closely, you can see that in the midst of all this
light, there is a small blemish of darkness at the base of a huge rock
that blocks the path.  Strange ciphers are etched into the rock's surface. 
Could they be the key to continuing on your adventure?

e
Along the Sea Floor
  Dimly lit, this space is close and cramped.  The ceiling seems to press
down upon you.  Reaching up, you feel something odd.  It is a smooth surface,
with what might be a clasp or lock of some kind.  Peering through the murky
darkness, you realize that this is another house, again strangely intact. 
However, whatever force brought this house here hasn't left it unscathed. 
It is actually upside down, lodged between two rocks!  Perhaps you can
explore it further by opening what just might be a window over your head.  

[ Exits: south west (up) ]
A school of goldfish flashes by.

>>    *[NOEXP]* An Upside-Down House!

into the depths must have happened so quickly that the air was trapped
inside it.  There is an aura of energy about the room that makes your
hair stand on end.  This place is a mess, though, with all the objects
strewn about and everything topsy-turvy.  A few items seem to have been
placed to rights, but the overall order of the room is chaotic.

You step into the Blemish of Darkness and arrive in...
Under the Rock
  You tumble out from under the rock into what looks to be a completely
different part of the sea.  You are shrouded in an inky blackness, no longer
able to see the light of the sky above.  Ahead, however, glimpses of light
shimmer through the water toward you.  The beginnings of a coral reef, by
the looks of it: beauty in the depths of darkness.

n
The Beginning of a Coral Reef
  All around you a reef comprised of coral spreads along the sea's bottom. 
Here you can see that a path has been cleared.  It is strangely meandering,
however, as if the creator were incapable of forging a straight line. 
Looking around you, it seems fairly obvious that the creatures here with
you are more than likely the culprits.

Wandering Through the Coral (G)
  Everywhere you look, the denizens of this land slither along.  The coral
looms over you, trapping you in the murky depths.  Perhaps this quest is
destined to be ill-fated.  Feeling as if failure is predestined, you

[*Daily Blessing*] 970/1092 HP  638/1495 MP  1310/1322 mv  960tnl  
Lv 51  G 330025 | Wandering Through the Coral (NS)
>>    *[NOEXP]* 
n
A Coral Cavern (G)
  Here, the walls rise high overhead.  The water rushes in from behind you,
trying to push you farther along.  Grabbing onto a jutting wall, you pause
to get your bearings.  To your left you can see a small cave, virtually
undetectable without close examination.  To the north, the coral closes in

Deep in the Coral

far wall!  It's an arrow, directing you to continue on to the north;
finally, a sign that you are heading along the correct path.  

[ Exits: north south ]
A shiver dances up your spine as you meet this menacing creature's gaze.
Maybe you should steer clear of this giant.
Maybe you should steer clear of this giant.

The Beginning of a Coral Reef
  All around you a reef comprised of coral spreads along the sea's bottom. 
Here you can see that a path has been cleared.  It is strangely meandering,
however, as if the creator were incapable of forging a straight line.

you are more than likely the culprits.

looms over you, trapping you in the murky depths.  Perhaps this quest is
destined to be ill-fated.  Feeling as if failure is predestined, you

Lv 51  G 330353 | Wandering Through the Coral (NS)
>>    *[NOEXP]* A Coral Cavern (G)
  Here, the walls rise high overhead.  The water rushes in from behind you,
trying to push you farther along.  Grabbing onto a jutting wall, you pause
to get your bearings.  To your left you can see a small cave, virtually
undetectable without close examination.  To the north, the coral closes in
again, with barely enough room for you to pass.

Deep in the Coral
  The coral walls close in around you as you travel deeper into this
realm of sea snakes.  Luckily, you are able to use these same walls
to keep yourself from being swept away by the current.  To the west
you can see another cave.  A quick push in that direction should be
enough to get you out of the rush of water.  As you brace to shove
off, you feel a give in the opposite wall.

A Sea Snake Dwelling

the residents seem to be settling down to a meal.  Little snakes slyly stick

A Strangely Glowing Rock
  Here, the dim light that has guided your path coalesces into one
brilliant pinpoint.  The entire area seems to almost throb with otherworldly
phosphorescence.  Looking closely, you can see that in the midst of all this
light, there is a small blemish of darkness at the base of a huge rock
that blocks the path.  Strange ciphers are etched into the rock's surface. 
Could they be the key to continuing on your adventure?

>>    *[NOEXP]* 
e
Along the Sea Floor
  Dimly lit, this space is close and cramped.  The ceiling seems to press
down upon you.  Reaching up, you feel something odd.  It is a smooth surface,
with what might be a clasp or lock of some kind.  Peering through the murky
darkness, you realize that this is another house, again strangely intact. 
However, whatever force brought this house here hasn't left it unscathed. 
It is actually upside down, lodged between two rocks!  Perhaps you can
explore it further by opening what just might be a window over your head.  

[ Exits: south west up ]

A Small Coral Cave (G)
  After battling the current, you find yourself in a smallish cave.  The
walls glow with an eerie light, the source of which seems to be some kind of
small worm.  As they move, they leave behind a trail of illumination.  Your
eye tracks the path of one close to the floor, and as you watch it seems to
disappear from sight!

The Grand Plaza (G) (1321)

Among the Philosophes (G)
  To the south of the Grand Plaza is a magnificent Stoa built entirely of
white marble.  A series of steps lead into the body proper of the building,
which is encircled by peristyle ionic columns and decorated in the ionic
style.  The greatest minds of all Andolor congregate here to debate matters
of philosophy, or just to think great thoughts in the same corridors where
thinkers past have done so.  The most sought-out magister of them all is
Questor, who dispenses worldly knowledge and experience by giving
assignments to those who ask.  Those who yearn for knowledge and
understanding flock to the Stoa, and they are never disappointed.  Any time
of day or night, conversations can be heard on subjects as lofty as the
meaning of life and the nature of death and the hereafter.  

[ Exits: north east south up ]
(Player) (White Aura) BloodHoof the Hunter.
(Player) (Translucent) (OPK) Icaerus looks for rare mobs..
(Player) Hild the Soldier.
(Player) Piro the Hunter.
The world famous Master Questor of Aylor hands out quests to adventurers.

help meditate
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : MEDITATION MEDITATE.
Help Category : Survival.
Related Helps : Vitality, Fast healing.
Last Updated  : 2017-08-31 22:28:29.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

This is an automatic skill.

Through training the mind, certain characters are able to use focus and
concentration when resting in order to increase their mana recovery
rate. Meditation skill is checked every tick, and if successful, you
will recover more mana.

Primary stat: Intelligence.
Affected by : Luck.


----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Inside the East Gate
  You are inside the east gate of Cradlebrook.  People hurry along the
road, eager to get to their destinations.  The road within the village is
well-used, despite the poor trails outside - it seems the villagers like
to keep to themselves.  The walls of the village surround you to the
south, and the east gate is open.  To the west the cobbled street
continues.

[ Exits: east west ]

The Creek in the Village

further down a bridge has been built.  You can see several villagers drawing
water in small wooden buckets, and more than one person sits on the banks with
line and lure, looking to catch a fish.  There is a wide roadway to the east,
and a slightly smaller one to the west.

w
The Home of Chief Lalo
  You have entered into a well-built, beautiful home.  Built of smoothed grey
stone, the house is large and regal.  There is a large, glass window that gives
a great view of the street and creek.  This part of the house seems to be the
living area.  A large bed sits in the western corner, while a table and
fireplace dominate the centre of the room.  A vase of flowers rests on a small
table by the window.  There is another room to the north, and the east door
leads back to the street.

[ Exits: north east ]
Yarrow, Lalo's wife, sits here, looking wistfully out the door.

>>    Outside the Aylorian Academy (G) (1321)

Boot Clan Public Hall (G)
  You have wandered out of the Academy and into Boot Camps clanhall. 
Clans are a special thing on aardwolf allowing like minded people to 
come together. Read help clans for more information. Boot Camp is a 
clan designed to help new players learn more about the game and we 
enjoy doing it. Read help boot and help newbieclan to learn more. 
This area is not a part of the Academy and the first thing you should 
do on Aardwolf is complete the Academy goal. We offer newbie starter 
kits to all new players. If you would like one please send a member a 
tell. You can type who boot to see who is online. If they do not 
respond then they are most likely afk. All items in our newbie kits 
are also sold in this shop. Type list if you would like to take a look 
at them. To return to the Academy type north.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A commissary shopkeeper stands here, begging you to type 'list'.

Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

[ Exits: east (down) ]

symbols.  A large black gate leads to the west.

Ice Room (G) (1279)

Ice Room
  You are standing in a room of ice.  Icicles of every size hang from the
ceiling.  Some shake with every sound.  Your reflection off the ice walls
seems to dance and wiggle as you move about.  To the north and west you see
more of the frozen room.  To the east you see a freezer door.

Meat Locker
  Rows of beef and other meats hang from large steel hooks.  You notice
that many of the things hanging from the hooks are corpses of people.  They
reach out to you as you pass them as if to plead for help from their frozen
mouths.  The meat locker continues to the south.  There is a freezer door to
the east.

Office of Complaints
  This is a relatively small office.  There is a large hole in the wall
where a clerk usually sits and takes complaints about hell.  As you peek
behind the counter you see a large paper shredder and a lot of shredded
complaints.  A sign over the clerk's desk reads, 'Hours: 12:00am - 12:01am'

Approaching a small mining camp
  A raging dust storm swirls about the base of the mountain, piercing your
weathered eyes with its ungodly strength.  You grit your teeth against the
pain and struggle onward, hoping the storm will soon cease.  The side of the
mountain to your east is as black as charred flesh and there are no green
plants to lend color or life to the scene.  The wind does not let up, and
you hasten to find some kind of shelter.  May this forsaken place be forever
damned.  

[ Exits: south up ]
     A fresh oak sign protrudes from the charred ground.
Beatrice the adventurer walks about here, scaling the mountain.
Beatrice sits down on a large rock, takes a sandwich out of her backpack, and begins to chew
silently. After a minute or two she spots you.
Beatrice asks, "Hi, I'm Beatrice. Who are you?"
You tell Beatrice that your name is KumoGami.
Beatrice asks, "Nice to meet you, KumoGami. Perhaps you would like to know
 more about Sargasso?"

Just outside Sargasso
  The dark granite encompasses the area as far as your eye can see.  You
begin to feel cold, scared, and claustrophobic as its proverbial weight
crushes your chest, leaving you with no room to breathe.  You gasp for air
and your pulse begins racing ...  Harder and harder you reach out, trying to
grasp at the heavy air that you know is there but that you just can't touch.
You race forward, panicked, and suddenly pass out ...  

When you come to, you are at the wooden gate of some strange mining
settlement.  Very few people are around, but for some reason that does not
strike you as being very strange.  Looking to the north, you notice that the
mountain has closed behind you, leaving behind no trace of the dust storm
or of the smell of burnt flesh.  You have no choice but to continue onward.

[ Exits: north (south) ]
A Sargasso guard walks around here, defending the prospectors.
A gateguard is here chatting with his friends and wasting time.
A gateguard is here protecting Sargasso.
A beast of burden is here hauling some iron ore.
A sargasso miner shuffles along lazily here.
A gateguard is here chatting with his friends and wasting time.
A gateguard is here protecting Sargasso.

[*Daily Blessing*] 987/1092 HP  1060/1495 MP  1274/1322 mv  656tnl  
Lv 51  G 364998 | Just outside Sargasso (NS)
>>    Inside Sargasso's gate
  Still a bit groggy from your difficult journey (and because you've just
recovered from passing out) you feel extremely disoriented, and in fact
almost feel like you have to pass out again.  Harnessing all your strength
and all your will, you manage to fight off the urge.  Who knows WHERE you
might end up if you were to fall unconscious again!  After the dizzy
spell passes, you notice that you are inside a small mining settlement that
has mysteriously sprung up by the mountain.  The ground beneath your feet is
composed of a dark brown substance that is similar to dirt, but feels a bit
more squishy beneath your feet.  What strikes you most of all, however, is
the fact that no one seems to be happy.  They are too concerned with making
money, many having presumably left behind their wives and children in hopes
of making a quick gold coin.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]

[*Daily Blessing*] 987/1092 HP  1060/1495 MP  1271/1322 mv  656tnl  
Lv 51  G 364998 | Inside Sargasso's gate (NESW)
>>    
s
s
Approaching a small mine shaft
  After having spent some time in the dirty, run down settlement of
Sargasso, you realize that the only thing the prospectors have is mining. 
They left their families and decided to dedicate themselves to one single
task.  The wind starts to pick up a little and the weird dirt-stuff flies
around for a little bit, but the gusts are not nearly as horrible as when
you were walking upon the mountain.  Still, the smell of charred flesh,
which was absent to the north, lingers on here.  What could these miners be
doing to paint such a horrid picture of the town?  You shrug off the
question, thinking it could not possibly be on purpose.  To the west you see
a beautifully colored hut and wonder why something so vibrant would be in a
place of such death and misery.  

[ Exits: north south west ]
A sargasso miner shuffles along lazily here.
A Sargasso guard walks around here, defending the prospectors.

[*Daily Blessing*] 987/1092 HP  1060/1495 MP  1270/1322 mv  656tnl  
Lv 51  G 364998 | Approaching a small mine shaft (NSW)
>>    Inside a small mine shaft
  Rotting oak posts support the ceiling of this very old looking mine
shaft.  You find this to be very strange, because all the other clues point
to the fact that Sargasso is a relatively new settlement.  How odd.  Maybe
there's something more to the mineshaft ...  something beautiful, yet
forgotten for countless ages.  The upper level of the mine shaft continues
south of here, or you can explore the depths of the mine below.  

[ Exits: north south down ]

[*Daily Blessing*] 987/1092 HP  1060/1495 MP  1269/1322 mv  656tnl  
Lv 51  G 364998 | Inside a small mine shaft (NSD)
>>    
d
Exploring underground
  This mine shaft is certainly much bigger than you thought it would be! 
It appears that the Sargasso miners certainly found a bit more than ore when
they dug deep inside the ground.  The underground caverns seem almost
endless, and you can't help but notice that they seem to be very ancient,
unlike the relatively new mine shaft.  You can climb back up the rope to the
mining settlement, but you get the feeling that it would be much nicer to
explore underground instead.  Paths spiral off in each direction, and you
really don't know which would be the best way to go.  Tiny little runes are
carved inside one of the cavern's walls in runny black ink.  Maybe coming to
Sargasso wasn't such a huge waste after all.

s
Exploring underground
  Even though you are still relatively close to the Sargasso mineshaft, you
cannot believe how different this place is from the accursed town.  Whereas
Sargasso had almost nothing but horror and evil, the underground has a
mysterious quality.  You don't know exactly how to catergorize it: sometimes
the cavern gives off a feeling of warmth and light, other times you cringe
in fear, wondering if your own shadow has turned against you.  Bowing your
head slightly, you utter a quick prayer to your god, asking him to protect
you.  The tunnel opens up into a huge chamber here, and by the way the dust
flies around the opening you can tell that some entity passed through here
quite recently.  

[ Exits: north east west ]
An earth elemental lumbers slowly across the ground here.
An earth elemental lumbers slowly across the ground here.

>>    The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.

stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)

adventurers.

Crown Street
  Crown Street is marked by the symbol of a crown embedded in the cobblestones.
The street is crowded and many of the people head down the alley to the east.

door are stained glass, and the wall's stones look new. The street continues 
to the north and south.

A Hidden Passage
  This hidden passage is lit by several candles which appear to burn all the 
time. The dark stones of the walls have worn smooth from age, and they absorb
the light. The dark passage has a ladder which leads through a large door 
above you.

The Altar of Rejuvenation (G)
  This altar is dedicated to all of the gods. Here you are able to rest and 
pray. The altar is covered with depictions of each god. It is here that a 
king-in-waiting will take his final steps to become a king. A king will stay 
in meditation before the altar praying for days for the blessing of the gods.
If he is found worthy, then he may assume the crown. As you stand before the 
altar, a small draft blows from the west from behind it.

[ Exits: south west ]

Entrance to the Seals of Kingsholm
  You are standing before the protective seals of Kingsholm. The seals were 
created by some of the greatest wizards born, and each seal is named for its 
maker. Should all the seals fall, Kingsholm will be at the mercy of its 
enemies. Therefore, each seal is guarded by immortal warriors who will fight 
to the death to protect the seals.

[ Exits: (east) down ]
The guardian of the seals stops you.

>>    The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Boot Clan Public Hall (G)
  You have wandered out of the Academy and into Boot Camps clanhall. 
Clans are a special thing on aardwolf allowing like minded people to 
come together. Read help clans for more information. Boot Camp is a 
clan designed to help new players learn more about the game and we 
enjoy doing it. Read help boot and help newbieclan to learn more. 
This area is not a part of the Academy and the first thing you should 
do on Aardwolf is complete the Academy goal. We offer newbie starter 
kits to all new players. If you would like one please send a member a 
tell. You can type who boot to see who is online. If they do not 
respond then they are most likely afk. All items in our newbie kits 
are also sold in this shop. Type list if you would like to take a look 
at them. To return to the Academy type north.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A commissary shopkeeper stands here, begging you to type 'list'.

[*Daily Blessing*] 697/1092 HP  474/1495 MP  1320/1322 mv  521tnl  
Lv 51  G 365123 | Boot Clan Public Hall (NESW)
w
>>    Recreation Room (G)
  Walking into the room, you notice there is a relaxed, friendly atmosphere and
almost everyone is in military uniform. A jukebox is playing a lively tune 
and some of the patrons are having fun dancing to the music. The sound of 
laughter coming from one end of the bar, as someone has just delivered the 
punch line of a good joke. Plush, comfortable looking, couches are scattered 
around the large room in clusters of two and three, allowing for more 
intimate gatherings and private conversations. The enlisted and the officers 
mingle together amicably and everyone is on excellent terms with the 
bartender.

[ Exits: east south west ]
An old veteran stands behind the bar, ready to serve you a cool drink.

[*Daily Blessing*] 697/1092 HP  474/1495 MP  1319/1322 mv  521tnl

>>    Mudpits (G)

an older man in a brown uniform who is as tough as
nails.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

[*Daily Blessing*] 739/1092 HP  562/1495 MP  1322/1322 mv  521tnl

>>    Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

[ Exits: east (down) ]

The Gates of Kingsholm
  The large iron gates of Kingsholm lie before you, and the bustling city is 
visible through them. The open gates reveal the stone streets of the city.
High castle walls protect the city, and several guards look down upon you as 
you enter the city.

[ Exits: north south ]

King's Square
  The intersection of King's Street and Griffon Street is a huge square 
surrounded by shops and homes. Canopies cover the doors and windows of the 
shops, protecting their customers from any poor weather. Scents of cooking 
fill the air, and the noise of the crowds shopping and talking fill the air.
A large fountain in the middle of the square squirts water high into the air.
The fountain depicts a boy shooting an arrow into the sky, but instead of an 
arrow water squirts out. A large grate on the street is used for the city's 
sewage, and an odor rises from it. King's Street continues to the north and 
south, while Griffon Street runs to the east and west.

[*Daily Blessing*] 1092/1092 HP  545/1495 MP  1322/1322 mv  517tnl  
Lv 51  G 365765 | The Seal of Nomira ([E])
>>    
help spells
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : Skills Spells.
Help Category : Miscellaneous.
Related Helps : Allspells, Practice, Qspells, Showskill, Forgetskill.
Last Updated  : 2015-10-12 16:47:11.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Syntax: skills ((<from level> <to level>) (<filter>) | all)
        spells ((<from level> <to level>) (<filter>) | all)

The skills and spells commands are used to display your character's list of
available skills (or spells, as the case may be).  They are listed in order
of level.  The practiced percentage is listed, as well as the spell number
(see 'help cast') and casting cost for spells.

Without a level range, these commands will show all abilities from level 1
to your current level.  Specifying a range will show all skills/spells for
the given range.  Forgotten Skills or spells (see 'help forgetskill') are
not displayed unless the 'all' option is used.

You may also use any of the following filters for these commands:

    Affected   - abilities currently affecting you
    Area       - abilities that target an entire room
    Attack     - abilities that add an additional attack to combat
    Bad        - abilities that cause a bad affect on the target
    Combat     - combat-based abilities
    Curative   - abilities that remove bad affects
    Dodge      - the basic dodge abilities
    Healing    - abilities that heal, or affect healing
    Learned    - abilities that have been practiced above 1%
    Movement   - abilities that transport you or others
    Nofail     - all nofail abilities (see 'help nofail')
    Object     - abilities that are used on objects
    Other      - abilities that can be used on others
    Passive    - abilities that are used automatically
    Pets       - abilities that create or control pets
    Resist     - abilities that add resistances
    Spellup    - beneficial abilities
    <Stat>     - abilities that give a bonus to the given stat
    <Damtype>  - any damage type such as 'fire' - see 'help damtypes'
    Stats      - abilities that add any stats
    Unaffected - abilities that are currently NOT affecting you
    Weapon     - weapon skills

----------------------------------------------------------------------------

[*Daily Blessing*] 1092/1092 HP  545/1495 MP  1322/1322 mv  517tnl

intelligence.

w
A Very Hectic Room
  All that can be seen through the haze of smoke are bodies upon bodies of
people attempting to get to a seat, a drink, a dancer, or all the above. 
People jostle against one another, sometimes by accident, other times on
purpose.  One seat appears to open and several patrons try to be the first
to get to it.  Beneath the feet of the crowd is a floor so incredibly
sticky, as though large spiders had spun a web upon the rocks.  The constant
shoving and pushing through this portion of the club is intense, causing
some patrons to try slinking along the walls.  To one side, someone
discovers their coin purse is missing, and a forlorn cry of sorrow can be heard
over the din.  

[ Exits: east south ]
A guard with entirely too much muscle watches every move made by those around him.

>>    *[NOEXP]* Dark Guard Chamber
  Another room which has the air of enforcement about it, this dimly lit

hectic market and other distractions above.  Serious business is
accomplished in these halls, and there is no doubt as to the penalty for
causing mischief.

Black Magiks
  A small fire ahead lights the room warmly.  There appears to be a stone

red writing and are burned at the edges.  A small sign says "Buyer Beware -

Surging energies
  The air here crackles with intensity.  Blackened scars on the walls still
hold a lingering scent of sulfur, fire, and something less pleasing to the

dust from the ceiling down upon the unwary, and that sound blends in with
the muffled chanting.

Shifting air currents
  Suddenly the air takes on a different feel.  It seems to shimmer, and
reflect light differently, blurring the edges of vision slightly.  Colors
seem to blend together a little more, making shapes appear indistinct. 
Faintly, the sound of fizzling or buzzing can be heard in the air, almost as
though an insect swarm is flying nearby.  It's obvious that there are
powerful magics cast about here, and wisdom dictates even more caution than
it's taken to make it this far!

Testing area
  There is a great deal of evidence in this room indicating it is used for
testing.  The things which are tested here range from unpleasant to outright
mind-numbingly unbearable.  Portions of bodies, many of which are
unrecognizable beyond being bloody chunks, are scattered about.  The walls
seem to still reverberate with the sound of pained screams.  The longer a
body lingers in this room, the more discomforting it becomes.  This can be a
true test of endurance.

Sparkling corner

molded from silver, and has a very menacing look about it.  Strange noises

Gilded hallway
  This hallway is decorated more nicely than what has been seen so far.  It
appears that beyond here, for those who make it, is where the priciest of
transactions take place.  Slaves whose sole purpose in this world is to keep
this hallway clean spend hours on their knees, scrubbing every inch of
floor.  There are slits within the wall, designed to be money-drops for
large sums of cash.  It's obvious a large amount of money makes its way
through here daily.

Pricey Selections

n
Split in the cave
  This portion of the cave is kept very neat.  The pathway through the
treasures is wide and level, while the stacks are extremely neat, much more
so than any other portion of this cave.  The dust becomes a problem for
sinuses here, as there is not a chance for it to settle on the objects, so
it has no place else to go.  A dull glow is coming from the west,
accompanied by the faint sound of ticking.

>>    *[NOEXP]* Entrance to Unknown Treasures
  Looking closely at this portion of cave upon entering reveals that there
is constant activity through there.  Signs of heavy objects being moved, as
well as a great deal of foot traffic mark the dust on the floor.  Further
into the caves the air seems fresher than what it is elsewhere at this
depth.  Perhaps there are more secrets yet!

In a Field

tall grasses, each having a bamboo-like stem.  The breeze rustles through the
narrow, sword-shaped leaves.  Insects buzz around the sweet sap oozing from
a cut plant.  Tasting the sap yourself, you realize you are in a field of
sugarcane.

help wang
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : Wangrp Wang.
Help Category : Communication.
Related Helps : Channels.
Last Updated  : 2009-09-19 02:17:09.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
The wangrp channel (often nicknamed 'wang') is visible to all players that
have it turned on.  It will show your name, level, and alignment, to help you
easily find someone to group with.

See 'help channels' for a list of functions that can be used on this channel.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

On the Ocean Floor
  Resting your feet against the ocean floor, you stop and realize that you
do not feel the intense pressure you thought you might at this depth.  You
can move about with relative ease, almost as if on surface.  While relaxing
to strained muscles after the long swim, it is also a curious sensation. 
Looking around in an attempt to survey the vista before you, a dark shadow
of movement above causes you to grasp your weapon just a little more
tightly.  What strange new world have you entered, and are you welcome?

>>    *[NOEXP]* The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.

stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)

adventurers.

  The valley you travel through is marred by an opening caused by a
recent earthquake.  The sun casts trails of light that reach deep in
the opening illuminating what appears to be mason work.  Looking in,
you can see that the sides of the crevasse form a rough staircase

The crevasse
  Climbing down the crevasse you are plagued by aftershocks that cause you
to lose your grip.  With each move you set loose rocks tumbling down letting
you know how far you would fall.  Your light begins to illuminate what seems
to be a large hall farther below.

Boot Clan Public Hall (G)
  You have wandered out of the Academy and into Boot Camps clanhall. 
Clans are a special thing on aardwolf allowing like minded people to 
come together. Read help clans for more information. Boot Camp is a 
clan designed to help new players learn more about the game and we 
enjoy doing it. Read help boot and help newbieclan to learn more. 
This area is not a part of the Academy and the first thing you should 
do on Aardwolf is complete the Academy goal. We offer newbie starter 
kits to all new players. If you would like one please send a member a 
tell. You can type who boot to see who is online. If they do not 
respond then they are most likely afk. All items in our newbie kits 
are also sold in this shop. Type list if you would like to take a look 
at them. To return to the Academy type north.

Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

>>    *[NOEXP]* Recreation Room (G)
  Walking into the room, you notice there is a relaxed, friendly atmosphere and
almost everyone is in military uniform. A jukebox is playing a lively tune 
and some of the patrons are having fun dancing to the music. The sound of 
laughter coming from one end of the bar, as someone has just delivered the 
punch line of a good joke. Plush, comfortable looking, couches are scattered 
around the large room in clusters of two and three, allowing for more 
intimate gatherings and private conversations. The enlisted and the officers 
mingle together amicably and everyone is on excellent terms with the 
bartender.

A great hall
  As you pass through a painted ceiling you emerge into a great hall.  
The tiles on the floor seem to make a pattern of some sort but the 
dust makes it hard to see.  Large Ionic pillars line the east and 
west walls of this room.  The southern wall is buried under dirt and 
rocks.  You see a faint light coming from an alcove to the north.  It 
adds an eerie glow to the room.

[ Exits: north up ]
     One of the small rocks the villager dropped is here. [2/2]

1018/1109 HP  1340/1521 MP  1338/1339 mv  676tnl  
Lv 52  G 370084 | A great hall (NU)
>>    *[NOEXP]* 
n
An alcove
  The alcove is large enough that a giant could fit comfortably.  Its
walls are lined by smaller pillars that you saw in the hall.  In the center
there sits a large throne that seems to be carved right out of the wall. 
Upon the throne sits a slightly cracked statue that is the source of the
faint light.  

[ Exits: south ]
(White Aura) A cracked statue is placed here giving off an eerie glow.
A cracked statue says, "Greetings, follower of the light."
A cracked statue says, "Long ago I was carved from the stones of this
 place. I have seen when the light and dark worked together in harmony, a
 perfect balance. Then something happened, suddenly they started warring.
 Nobody knows why or who is to blame. Obviously, the light blames the dark
 and the dark blames the light. Luckily, Malcrom is attempting to figure
 out who is truly to blame."
A cracked statue says, "If you would like to hear more, please indicate
 that you accept."
A cracked statue says, "If you don't want to help, you may either join the
 dark or join the light."

1018/1109 HP  1340/1521 MP  1337/1339 mv  676tnl  
Lv 52  G 370084 | An alcove (S)
>>    *[NOEXP]* 
goals citadel

                     Goal information for: Citadel 
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Since the beginning of time have the light and dark forces been battling. Many
years have passed and nobody is quite sure why anymore. The light side blames
the dark for their evil ways and uncaring attitudes. The dark side blames the
light for their easy going, happy go-lucky ways. Only one person that can truly
sort all this out. Malcrom has been trying to determine who is truly to blame 
for centuries. All he lacks is the stories from each side, for, he is stuck in
the clouds and cannot retrieve the stories from each side. Once he gets both 
sides of the story, surely, he will be able to figure out who started this all.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Difficulty       : Easy                
Recommended Level:  70
Maximum Level    : 201
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
You have not yet unlocked any of the tasks in this quest.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

n
An alcove
  The alcove is large enough that a giant could fit comfortably.  Its
walls are lined by smaller pillars that you saw in the hall.  In the center
there sits a large throne that seems to be carved right out of the wall.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.

stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)

Boot Clan Public Hall (G)
  You have wandered out of the Academy and into Boot Camps clanhall. 
Clans are a special thing on aardwolf allowing like minded people to 
come together. Read help clans for more information. Boot Camp is a 
clan designed to help new players learn more about the game and we 
enjoy doing it. Read help boot and help newbieclan to learn more. 
This area is not a part of the Academy and the first thing you should 
do on Aardwolf is complete the Academy goal. We offer newbie starter 
kits to all new players. If you would like one please send a member a 
tell. You can type who boot to see who is online. If they do not 
respond then they are most likely afk. All items in our newbie kits 
are also sold in this shop. Type list if you would like to take a look 
at them. To return to the Academy type north.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A commissary shopkeeper stands here, begging you to type 'list'.

Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) (Invis) (Hidden) (Translucent) (White Aura) Talbor the Enchanter.
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

>>    *[NOEXP]* Mudpits (G)
  You stand in a training field with wet and muddy grounds.
As you continue down the fields,you realize that 
this was once a battlefield of the worthy and ruthless
but it has now been swept and turned into a training
ground.

this field is still be used as a training center, and
an older man in a brown uniform who is as tough as
nails.

>>    *[NOEXP]* Recreation Room (G)
  Walking into the room, you notice there is a relaxed, friendly atmosphere and
almost everyone is in military uniform. A jukebox is playing a lively tune 
and some of the patrons are having fun dancing to the music. The sound of 
laughter coming from one end of the bar, as someone has just delivered the 
punch line of a good joke. Plush, comfortable looking, couches are scattered 
around the large room in clusters of two and three, allowing for more 
intimate gatherings and private conversations. The enlisted and the officers 
mingle together amicably and everyone is on excellent terms with the 
bartender.

A great hall
  As you pass through a painted ceiling you emerge into a great hall.  
The tiles on the floor seem to make a pattern of some sort but the 
dust makes it hard to see.  Large Ionic pillars line the east and 
west walls of this room.  The southern wall is buried under dirt and 
rocks.  You see a faint light coming from an alcove to the north.  It 
adds an eerie glow to the room.

An alcove
  The alcove is large enough that a giant could fit comfortably.  Its
walls are lined by smaller pillars that you saw in the hall.  In the center
there sits a large throne that seems to be carved right out of the wall. 
Upon the throne sits a slightly cracked statue that is the source of the
faint light.

>>    *[NOEXP]* A great hall

dust makes it hard to see.  Large Ionic pillars line the east and

rocks.  You see a faint light coming from an alcove to the north.  It 
adds an eerie glow to the room.

An alcove
  The alcove is large enough that a giant could fit comfortably.  Its
walls are lined by smaller pillars that you saw in the hall.  In the center
there sits a large throne that seems to be carved right out of the wall.

faint light.

 place. I have seen when the light and dark worked together in harmony, a
 perfect balance. Then something happened, suddenly they started warring.

 and the dark blames the light. Luckily, Malcrom is attempting to figure
 out who is truly to blame."

 that you accept."
A cracked statue says, "If you don't want to help, you may either join the
 dark or join the light."

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Boot Clan Public Hall (G)
  You have wandered out of the Academy and into Boot Camps clanhall. 
Clans are a special thing on aardwolf allowing like minded people to 
come together. Read help clans for more information. Boot Camp is a 
clan designed to help new players learn more about the game and we 
enjoy doing it. Read help boot and help newbieclan to learn more. 
This area is not a part of the Academy and the first thing you should 
do on Aardwolf is complete the Academy goal. We offer newbie starter 
kits to all new players. If you would like one please send a member a 
tell. You can type who boot to see who is online. If they do not 
respond then they are most likely afk. All items in our newbie kits 
are also sold in this shop. Type list if you would like to take a look 
at them. To return to the Academy type north.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A commissary shopkeeper stands here, begging you to type 'list'.

Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

[ Exits: east (down) ]
     A refrigerated milk cooler stands ready to serve all.
     Multiple beds line the wall, waiting for people to rest or be treated on them.
     An old electric heater.

894/1109 HP  1233/1521 MP  1121/1339 mv  696tnl  
Lv 52  G 371242 | Medical lounge (E[D])
>>    *[NOEXP]* 
help vampiric touch
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : 'Vampiric Touch'.
Help Category : Attack Spell.
Related Helps : Demonfire.
Last Updated  : 2017-08-26 21:15:42.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Syntax: cast 'vampiric touch' <victim>
Damage: negative
Spell Number: 179

This spell allows the caster to drain and feed off his/her target's life
force, thus returning the caster's own life as they drain their victim's.

Primary stat: Intelligence.
Affected by : Luck.


----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

>>    *[NOEXP]* Mudpits (G)
  You stand in a training field with wet and muddy grounds.
As you continue down the fields,you realize that 
this was once a battlefield of the worthy and ruthless
but it has now been swept and turned into a training
ground.
Apart from the worn paths and unpleasant pools of mud,
this field is still be used as a training center, and
an older man in a brown uniform who is as tough as
nails.

>>    *[NOEXP]* Recreation Room (G)
  Walking into the room, you notice there is a relaxed, friendly atmosphere and
almost everyone is in military uniform. A jukebox is playing a lively tune 
and some of the patrons are having fun dancing to the music. The sound of 
laughter coming from one end of the bar, as someone has just delivered the 
punch line of a good joke. Plush, comfortable looking, couches are scattered 
around the large room in clusters of two and three, allowing for more 
intimate gatherings and private conversations. The enlisted and the officers 
mingle together amicably and everyone is on excellent terms with the 
bartender.

[ Exits: east south west ]
An old veteran stands behind the bar, ready to serve you a cool drink.

A great hall
  As you pass through a painted ceiling you emerge into a great hall.

walls are lined by smaller pillars that you saw in the hall.  In the center

 place. I have seen when the light and dark worked together in harmony, a

>>    *[NOEXP]* The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.

in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.

stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)

adventurers.

At the Town Gates of Dharivian
  The huge gates are wide open, and the guard posted there gives you a warm
and friendly greeting.  It strikes you as out-of-place, though, as you
meander through the streets.  The crowds open before you like a parting sea-
the citizens of Dharivian act as though they're afraid you'll pass the
plague onto them.  Not that this is a place ripe for brewing disease - the
wooden buildings to either side of the street are freshly painted, and yards
neatly kept.  Even the dirt roads are free of debris, and when a child
carelessly tosses an apple core to the ground, her mother screams in fear
and gives her a swat.  Apparently littering isn't too popular here.

It's Not Easy Being Green (1309)

A Frosty Corridor in the Labyrinth
  The labyrinth continues.  Adventurers seeking to escape from the Queen's
maze may have considered that freezing the imprisoning hedges might make
them breakable.  Guess again.  Icicles hang from the shrubbery branches, and
the deathberries are coated with a fine misting of frost.  The temperature
here definitely dips into an uncomfortable zone, but the hedge branches
remain as hard as iron.  Things may be more comfortable to the south or
west, if one ignores the snarls and growls that can be heard.

>>    *[NOEXP]* The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.

stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)

adventurers.

>>    *[NOEXP]* 
w
Boot Clan Public Hall (G)
  You have wandered out of the Academy and into Boot Camps clanhall. 
Clans are a special thing on aardwolf allowing like minded people to 
come together. Read help clans for more information. Boot Camp is a 
clan designed to help new players learn more about the game and we 
enjoy doing it. Read help boot and help newbieclan to learn more. 
This area is not a part of the Academy and the first thing you should 
do on Aardwolf is complete the Academy goal. We offer newbie starter 
kits to all new players. If you would like one please send a member a 
tell. You can type who boot to see who is online. If they do not 
respond then they are most likely afk. All items in our newbie kits 
are also sold in this shop. Type list if you would like to take a look 
at them. To return to the Academy type north.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A commissary shopkeeper stands here, begging you to type 'list'.

1/996 HP  534/1417 MP  1338/1285 mv  848tnl  
Lv 52  G 372363 | Boot Clan Public Hall (NESW)
w
>>    *[NOEXP]* Recreation Room (G)
  Walking into the room, you notice there is a relaxed, friendly atmosphere and
almost everyone is in military uniform. A jukebox is playing a lively tune 
and some of the patrons are having fun dancing to the music. The sound of 
laughter coming from one end of the bar, as someone has just delivered the 
punch line of a good joke. Plush, comfortable looking, couches are scattered 
around the large room in clusters of two and three, allowing for more 
intimate gatherings and private conversations. The enlisted and the officers 
mingle together amicably and everyone is on excellent terms with the 
bartender.

[ Exits: east south west ]

1/996 HP  534/1417 MP  1336/1285 mv  848tnl

>>    *[NOEXP]* Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

w
Boot Clan Public Hall (G)
  You have wandered out of the Academy and into Boot Camps clanhall. 
Clans are a special thing on aardwolf allowing like minded people to 
come together. Read help clans for more information. Boot Camp is a 
clan designed to help new players learn more about the game and we 
enjoy doing it. Read help boot and help newbieclan to learn more. 
This area is not a part of the Academy and the first thing you should 
do on Aardwolf is complete the Academy goal. We offer newbie starter 
kits to all new players. If you would like one please send a member a 
tell. You can type who boot to see who is online. If they do not 
respond then they are most likely afk. All items in our newbie kits 
are also sold in this shop. Type list if you would like to take a look 
at them. To return to the Academy type north.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A commissary shopkeeper stands here, begging you to type 'list'.

>>    *[NOEXP]* Recreation Room (G)
  Walking into the room, you notice there is a relaxed, friendly atmosphere and
almost everyone is in military uniform. A jukebox is playing a lively tune 
and some of the patrons are having fun dancing to the music. The sound of 
laughter coming from one end of the bar, as someone has just delivered the 
punch line of a good joke. Plush, comfortable looking, couches are scattered 
around the large room in clusters of two and three, allowing for more 
intimate gatherings and private conversations. The enlisted and the officers 
mingle together amicably and everyone is on excellent terms with the 
bartender.

>>    *[NOEXP]* Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green

The Grand City of Aylor (G)

Before the entrance to the Underdark
  You stand before a huge door.  The corridor can easily fit fifteen humans
standing side by side here.  The floor has levelled off and has been worn
smooth by the dragging feet of the slave flocks.  You stand just before the
Underdark.  The Underdark is a huge city that rivals its surface
counterpart, Aylor.  From what you have heard, anything goes in the
Underdark.  A dangerous place at best, only those who have had at least ten
levels of experience should venture into it.  On the wall to the north are a
series of markings that you can't make out at this distance.  A huge door
stands to the west, the way to the surface is up.
