1085/1126 HP  1202/1550 MP  1296/1355 mv  655tnl  
Lv 53  G 415281 | Approaching the Camp (EW)
>>    *[NOEXP]* 


e
n
e
The Human Refugee Camp
  The human occupants of this ramshackle refugee camp consist almost
entirely of children and the elderly.  Those few that are outdoors, braving
the bitter cold, huddle about a small cook fire, arms extended, palms near
the flames.  To the east and south stand the two largest shelters found in
the camp.  With walls of lashed-together sticks and roofs of straw, these
meager structures are little more than hastily constructed huts.  Numerous
bootprints mark the snow, entering the camp from east and continuing on, in
much smaller numbers, to the north.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]
     (Magic) An iron cookpot simmers, suspended over the flames.
A wrinkled old man slowly stirs the pot.
An aged woman huddles within her many layers of clothes.

1105/1126 HP  1229/1550 MP  1347/1355 mv  655tnl  
Lv 53  G 415281 | The Human Refugee Camp (NESW)
>>    *[NOEXP]* At the Foot of the Volcano
  Here at the foot of the looming volcano, no wind blows, no animal calls
out and an eerie quiet abides.  Scraggly bushes, half buried in the deep
snow, provide shelter for the snowshoe rabbits which frequent this area.  A
small snare rests nearby, presently empty and unsprung.  A trail of boot
prints enters from the camp to the south and then turns east toward the
volcano's slopes.  

[ Exits: east south ]
(Hidden) A snowshoe rabbit makes little noise as it hides within the bushes.
(Player) (Invis) (White Aura) (OPK) Metzli is here.
The human hunter traps small game to feed his people.

1105/1126 HP  1229/1550 MP  1345/1355 mv  655tnl  
Lv 53  G 415281 | At the Foot of the Volcano (ES)
e
>>    *[NOEXP]* On a Snowbound Trail
  The entire Tbir Mountain is covered in snow.  The trail is buried
somewhere underneath several feet of snow, making travel up the side of the
mountain very treacherous.  Large trees can be seen in the distance, each
tree covered in icicles and the branches sag from the weight of the snow and
ice.  The freezing winds blow snow around on the ground leaving any
footprints covered.  Few people are willing to take the trek up the
mountain, as many who have, have never returned.  

[ Exits: east west ]
A fierce cold wind blows here.

1105/1126 HP  1229/1550 MP  1343/1355 mv  655tnl  
Lv 53  G 415281 | On a Snowbound Trail (EW)
>>    *[NOEXP]* On a Bleak Trail
  The mountain looms drearily over the campgrounds.  The desolate state of
the humans leaves little hope for them.  The snow seems to be never-ending
as it lightly falls yet again on the mountain.  The skies above are overcast
with dull grey clouds; it seems the sun never shines.  The mountain begins
to slope upwards here, a slight slope at first, but ahead it can be
discerned that the slope becomes greater.  

[ Exits: west up ]
A white ball of feathers is almost indistinguishable amidst the snow.
A fierce cold wind blows here.
This little gopher tries his best to bury himself in the snow.

1105/1126 HP  1229/1550 MP  1341/1355 mv  655tnl  
Lv 53  G 415281 | On a Bleak Trail (WU)
u
>>    *[NOEXP]* 
On a Treacherous Trail
  The snow covered rocks of the mountain make walking nearly impossible. 
The rocks shift and move with each footstep, leaving little room for
mistakes in climbing the large mountain.  The trek up the side of the
mountain seems endless as the wind begins to blow a bit harder.  Snow falls
lightly upon the ground, burying the pathway even further under all the snow
that has fallen already.  Footprints do not stay visible long, as the
falling snow and windy conditions seem to quickly cover them.  

[ Exits: west down ]
A light blizzard falls.
A fierce cold wind blows here.
(Invis) Digging into the snow bank, this ice nixie is up to no good.

On a Treacherous Trail
  The snow covered rocks of the mountain make walking nearly impossible. 
The rocks shift and move with each footstep, leaving little room for
mistakes in climbing the large mountain.  The trek up the side of the
mountain seems endless as the wind begins to blow a bit harder.  Snow falls
lightly upon the ground, burying the pathway even further under all the snow
that has fallen already.  Footprints do not stay visible long, as the
falling snow and windy conditions seem to quickly cover them.  

[ Exits: west down ]
A fierce cold wind blows here.
A light blizzard falls.

Lv 53  G 415281 | On a Treacherous Trail (WD)
>>    *[NOEXP]* 
w
On a Rugged Trail
  The rocks of the mountain seem to taper off here, although ahead more can
be seen.  The path isn't clear of rocks, but walking is a bit easier at this
point.  In the distance, a snowshoe rabbit can be seen in search for food. 
Although the rabbit blends in very well with the snow, it can be spotted due
to the dark color on the tip of the ears.  Even for the animals that live on
the mountain, food is very scarce.  The humans hunt the rabbits for food,
but due to the quickness of the rabbit, actually killing one for food is
rare.  

[ Exits: east west ]
A fierce cold wind blows here.

1126/1126 HP  1272/1550 MP  1335/1355 mv  655tnl  
Lv 53  G 415281 | On a Rugged Trail (EW)
w
>>    *[NOEXP]* On a Rocky Trail
  The rocks are bigger here than they are lower down the mountainside,
making it harder to navigate.  The rocks are big enough that the only way
across some of them is to climb over them.  The snow on the rocks makes it
very hard to get a good footing on them, thus making it very easy to slip. 
One wrong move could prove to be deadly, sending an adventurer tumbling to
their death on the jagged rocks below.  The climb up the mountain is
dangerous, although many humans have attempted the trek for the legendary
Fire Gem in hopes of bringing warmth back to the outside world.

[ Exits: east up ]

1126/1126 HP  1272/1550 MP  1333/1355 mv  655tnl  
Lv 53  G 415281 | On a Rocky Trail (EU)
>>    *[NOEXP]* 
u
On a Deadly Trail
  Partially covered in bloodstained snow is a half eaten human corpse.  It
is unclear if the human died from the freezing cold of the snow and wind,
and was then eaten, or if some savage animal attacked it and killed it for
food.  Either way, the remains are now frozen in time from the elements of
the severe snow storm.  The body couldn't have been here too awfully long,
as it would be completely covered in snow, or perhaps it has been dug up for
yet another meal before the body completely froze.  

[ Exits: east down ]
(Invis) This salivating ice nixie picks through the human's remains.

On a Windswept Trail
  The cold piercing wind is blowing fiercely from the west.  The only sound
in the distance is the roar of the wind.  Food and water are nowhere to be
found.  The land is barren, frost bitten, and covered in snow.  Camping here
would be a mistake.  The only direction to move towards is up.

At the Volcano's Summit
  The wind gusts, blowing the snow in a blizzard-like manner. The snow
falls heavily, covering any footsteps quickly.  The view from the top of the
mountain reveals nothing but snowy desolate land.  To the north, the opening
of the volcano can be seen in the distance.  The trek has been almost
unbearable.  The journey to the crater is still very dangerous.  Rocks jut
up from the snow - one wrong move could send any adventurer over the edge
to their death.

The Rim of the Crater
  The end of the difficult climb is marked with the rim of a giant crater. 
A tepid breeze blows up from within the volcano, while darkness swirls
around the adventurers who have dared to breach the isolation of the
volcano.  The inner wall of the crater is marked with niches for people to
attempt to climb down.  

[ Exits: south down ]

d
Within the Crater
  The bottom of the crater is marred by small rocks, large rocks - all
kinds of stones have been scattered around the dusty floor, with some rocks
as large as a small house.  The dust is disturbed by footprints of the
humans who have struggled past, going east and south through the few viable
paths in the rocks.  Creatures laugh at the hapless adventurers from their
safe perch at the rim of the crater, for they know, of those who have gone
down, few have returned intact.

Vast Corridor (1295)

Before the entrance to the Underdark
  You stand before a huge door.  The corridor can easily fit fifteen humans
standing side by side here.  The floor has levelled off and has been worn
smooth by the dragging feet of the slave flocks.  You stand just before the
Underdark.  The Underdark is a huge city that rivals its surface
counterpart, Aylor.  From what you have heard, anything goes in the
Underdark.  A dangerous place at best, only those who have had at least ten
levels of experience should venture into it.  On the wall to the north are a
series of markings that you can't make out at this distance.  A huge door
stands to the west, the way to the surface is up.

A Crack in the Rock
  You find yourself wedged in a crack just below the catacombs.  Strange
sounds come up from below.  Are the rumors true?  Are there dark forces
lurking within the granite depths?  If so, perhaps you should turn back now.
Unfortunately, the rock above does not seem to want to let you pass back
that way.  You peer into the gloom and see a path leading downward.  Your
only companion is a strange looking fellow whimpering softly.  

[ Exits: up down ]
A deathly pale man looks around anxiously.

The Crack Expands
  Working your way down deeper into the crack, you gain some breathing room
as the space opens up and levels off into the darkness.  Is this space a
random arrangement of rock?  Or does it include an element of design?  You
note the beautiful moss growing on the walls.

849/1126 HP  918/1550 MP  1355/1355 mv  655tnl

d
Ravine of Skulls [**> PK <**]
  Descending even deeper into this dark realm, you find yourself in a
narrow ravine with high rock walls.  The ground is littered with ugly oblong
skulls.  No armor is to be seen, so perhaps they were a primitive race. 
Despite the bleakness of the ravine, the mineral richness you encounter
continues to dazzle you.  Large green emeralds sparkle in the obsidian-like
rock that surrounds you.  Threading your way through pits of quicksand, you
see a trail leading south.  

[ Exits: south up ]
(Hidden) A squat and slippery grov waddles down the path.
A dumpy cave creature with a goatee looks for jewels.

An Amethyst Sea (G)
  You now float deep in a strange sea that sparkles as if it were made of

of Zangar.  In any case, you are in it, and rather lost.  All is flux and
convolution.  Strange sea creatures come and go, and what first appear to be
sedentary clams scramble about when you take your eyes off of them.

An Amethyst Sea
  You now float deep in a strange sea that sparkles as if it were made of
liquid amethyst.  Perhaps it is no more than a drop distilled from the magic
of Zangar.  In any case, you are in it, and rather lost.  All is flux and
convolution.  Strange sea creatures come and go, and what first appear to be
sedentary clams scramble about when you take your eyes off of them.  

[ Exits: north east south west up down ]

help fast healing
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : 'FAST HEALING'.
Help Category : Survival.
Related Helps : Meditation.
Last Updated  : 2017-08-16 10:27:58.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Syntax: <automatic>

After time spent training their body and testing it against the rigors
of the world, certain characters become much more hardy. This manifests
itself as an increased ability to recover from injuries, known as fast
healing. With every tick that passes, this ability is checked, and any
benefit passed on to the character. It is possible for this ability to
fail.  This is an automatic skill.

Primary stat: Constitution.
Affected by : None.


----------------------------------------------------------------------------

>>    *[NOEXP]* The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

>>    *[NOEXP]* Outside the Aylorian Academy (G) (1354)

Boot Clan Public Hall (G)
  You have wandered out of the Academy and into Boot Camps clanhall. 
Clans are a special thing on aardwolf allowing like minded people to 
come together. Read help clans for more information. Boot Camp is a 
clan designed to help new players learn more about the game and we 
enjoy doing it. Read help boot and help newbieclan to learn more. 
This area is not a part of the Academy and the first thing you should 
do on Aardwolf is complete the Academy goal. We offer newbie starter 
kits to all new players. If you would like one please send a member a 
tell. You can type who boot to see who is online. If they do not 
respond then they are most likely afk. All items in our newbie kits 
are also sold in this shop. Type list if you would like to take a look 
at them. To return to the Academy type north.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A commissary shopkeeper stands here, begging you to type 'list'.

Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some

e
e
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

1126/1126 HP  1550/1550 MP  1354/1355 mv  665tnl  
Lv 53  G 465347 | Boot Camp Headquarters (NE[S]WUD)

>>    *[NOEXP]* Mudpits (G)
  You stand in a training field with wet and muddy grounds.
As you continue down the fields,you realize that 
this was once a battlefield of the worthy and ruthless
but it has now been swept and turned into a training
ground.
Apart from the worn paths and unpleasant pools of mud,
this field is still be used as a training center, and
an older man in a brown uniform who is as tough as
nails.

[ Exits: east west down ]
Gunney Sergeant waits here to train you to exhaustion.

1126/1126 HP  1550/1550 MP  1353/1355 mv  665tnl  
Lv 53  G 465347 | Mudpits (EWD)
>>    *[NOEXP]* Recreation Room (G)
  Walking into the room, you notice there is a relaxed, friendly atmosphere and
almost everyone is in military uniform. A jukebox is playing a lively tune 
and some of the patrons are having fun dancing to the music. The sound of 
laughter coming from one end of the bar, as someone has just delivered the 
punch line of a good joke. Plush, comfortable looking, couches are scattered 
around the large room in clusters of two and three, allowing for more 
intimate gatherings and private conversations. The enlisted and the officers 
mingle together amicably and everyone is on excellent terms with the 
bartender.

[ Exits: east south west ]
An old veteran stands behind the bar, ready to serve you a cool drink.

Whitewind Avenue (G)
  You stand on Whitewind Avenue before a large intersection with a massive
statue and numerous people.  The city around you is incredible, with amazing
architecture, breathtaking horizons, and finely crafted roadwork.  Beneath
your feet, the road is made of a white translucent stone, likely quartz,
that sparkles in the sunlight.  To the north, the grand Aylorian Temple
stands high above the city.  

[ Exits: north east south west up down ]

1126/1126 HP  1550/1550 MP  1349/1355 mv  665tnl  
Lv 53  G 465347 | Whitewind Avenue (NESWUD)

>>    *[NOEXP]* Phoenix Square (G)
  At this, the main intersection of the Grand City of Aylor, the road is
shiny and black as if paved with ebony.  The road extends east and west,
reaching across the entire city.  In the center of this large square stands
a black and pink alabaster statue.  Beneath the statue, many solicitors try
to grab the attention of passersby.  To the north is the white marble temple. 
To the south, you gaze upon a large plaza with eight silver spires piercing
the sky.  

[ Exits: north east south west up ]
     A large black and pink statue sprays streams of water into the air.

>>    *[NOEXP]* Whitewind Avenue (G)
  You stand on Whitewind Avenue just south of a large intersection with a
large statue and numerous people.  The city around you is incredible, with
amazing architecture, breathtaking horizons, and finely crafted roadwork. 
Beneath your feet, the road is a white, translucent stone, likely quartz,
that sparkles in the sunlight.  Traveling south will take you to the world
famous Meridian Square.

1126/1126 HP  1550/1550 MP  1349/1355 mv  665tnl  
Lv 53  G 465347 | Whitewind Avenue (NSD)
>>    *[NOEXP]* 
s
North of the Grand Plaza (G)
  The sounds of the city echo between the buildings that line the sides of
this broad street.  Standing here, the oppressive size of the city is fully
evident.  The northern sky is dominated by the elegant spires of the Grand
Aylorian Temple, while the southern horizon is punctuated by glimpses of the
Guild towers.  A queer building rises up on the eastern side of the street,
though it seems to have developed a slight list to one side.  The door to
the building is boarded over and bears a sign reading: "Out of Order!!!! 
Decapitation Hazard!!  --Tinker's Guild Safety Committee."  In its place,
a complex series of pulleys operates a bucket that carries visitors up to a
second floor window.  Ominous explosions, thuds, and various other sounds of
mass destruction escape the building at random intervals.  In an alley
beside the slanting structure, a giant, clockwork machine of some sort
occasionally belches out clouds of smoke and fire.  A series of crudely
hammered metal chutes leading down from the upper stories of the structure
rains trash down into the incinerator.  A large sign in the alley reads:
"Posted: Hard Hat Zone."  

[ Exits: north south west other ]
A stout dwarf, Wesnir, walks slowly, admiring the views of Aylor.
A gnomish incinerator bot is here, belching smoke and fire.

1126/1126 HP  1550/1550 MP  1349/1355 mv  665tnl  
Lv 53  G 465347 | North of the Grand Plaza (NSW*)
>>    *[NOEXP]* 
s
The Grand Plaza (G)
  Day or night, people can be found in the Grand Plaza of Aylor. 
Merchants, both honest and otherwise, hock their wares, mercenaries offer
their services, and, once the sun sets, a bit of "company" is only an alley
away.  Plaza Guards mill through the crowd, keeping a weather eye out for
pickpockets, cutpurses, and other ne'er-do-wells.  The vast expanse of the
square is packed with all manner of booths and tables, but in the end most
eyes are drawn to the far corners of the plaza and to the Guild towers that
dominate them-each unique, and each magnificent.  The plaza is a place to
see and be seen, to buy and to sell, each according to his own agenda.

[ Exits: north east south west ]

1126/1126 HP  1550/1550 MP  1349/1355 mv  665tnl  
Lv 53  G 465347 | The Grand Plaza (NESW)
>>    *[NOEXP]* 
Global Quest: Global Quest # 8700 has been won by Marauder - 959th win.
Global Quest: Global Quest # 8700 will go into extended time for 5 more minutes.


s
Meridian Square (G)
  The focal point of the Grand Plaza of Aylor is Meridian Square, built not
to honor the sun, but rather the city itself.  In this place, the heart of
Aylor, the city's glory is always at its zenith.  The square honors the
spirit of defiance that made the founders of Aylor build a city so great
that its brightness would rival the sun's, its mighty towers so tall as to
scrape the clouds as they pass overhead.  The foremost feature of Meridian
Square is the memorial fountain, which pumps crystal clear water into the
sky year round.  A detachment of city guards known as the Honor Guard keep
watch over the fountain day and night.  The practical reason is to prevent
any defacement, but myth-lovers claim that they protect the massive marble
bier at the center of the fountain which is said to hold a container of the
Water of Life.  

[ Exits: north east south west up down ]
     (Glow) (Hum) A fountain dedicated to the ancient Builders of Andolor flows with pure water.

1126/1126 HP  1550/1550 MP  1349/1355 mv  665tnl  
Lv 53  G 465347 | Meridian Square (NESWUD)
>>    *[NOEXP]* 
s
The Grand Plaza (G)
  The south end of the plaza is traditionally home to salesmen of a more
refined sort.  The proximity of the Mage and Psionicist Guilds to the east
and the Stoa to the south guarantee that the sellers of rare books and
antiquities that gather here always have business.  Snatches of excited
conversation about this or that rare edition float about on the air, and
occasionally a voice will be raised to accuse some dishonest peddler of
pushing forgeries.  The Plaza Guards are more numerous here to guarantee the
security of the valuable goods for sale, as well as the safety of the
well-laden coin purses that dangle from the all-too-numerous belts.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]

1126/1126 HP  1550/1550 MP  1349/1355 mv  665tnl  
Lv 53  G 465347 | The Grand Plaza (NESW)
s
>>    *[NOEXP]* 
Among the Philosophes (G)
  To the south of the Grand Plaza is a magnificent Stoa built entirely of
white marble.  A series of steps lead into the body proper of the building,
which is encircled by peristyle ionic columns and decorated in the ionic
style.  The greatest minds of all Andolor congregate here to debate matters
of philosophy, or just to think great thoughts in the same corridors where
thinkers past have done so.  The most sought-out magister of them all is
Questor, who dispenses worldly knowledge and experience by giving
assignments to those who ask.  Those who yearn for knowledge and
understanding flock to the Stoa, and they are never disappointed.  Any time
of day or night, conversations can be heard on subjects as lofty as the
meaning of life and the nature of death and the hereafter.  

[ Exits: north east south up ]
(Player) Piro the Hunter.
The world famous Master Questor of Aylor hands out quests to adventurers.

>>    Armchair Avenger Clan Hall (G)
  This is where old farts come to hang out and complain about how much
better things were in the old days, when there were only three mobs in the
entire MUD, and one of them was Ivar.  You can still hear the faint whining
of issues no one actually cares about any more and the ghosts of inactive
players pop in from time to time to mutter something about all the damn
newbies.  There is a painting of Ivar on the mantle over the fireplace that
all the rocking chairs are crowded around.  In spite of all the chairs here,
most of the people in this room appear to be off their rocker.

In a Misty Swamp
  The air is heavy with a thick oppressiveness that permeates through the swamp.
Moss hangs heavy from the canopy of trees which block any light, leaving the
swamp in a constant atmosphere of dreary, depressing darkness.  A thick layer
of mist shrouds the waters and dank moss-coated lands.  Your skin feels clammy,
and the trickles of moisture sliding down your face feel eerily alive.  The
constant buzzing of blood-seeking mosquitoes do nothing to drown out the other
sounds of the swamp...  The sounds of life...  and death.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]
You blink out of existence and avoid a mist imp's attack.
A mist imp is in perfect health.

n
Before the Grand Gates of Castle Vlad-Shamir (G)
  Before you, rising up out of the swamp, is a forbidding edifice.  Huge,
imposing walls, hewn from the very bones of the earth, tower into the sky
above you, reminding you of the puny, insignificant mortal that you are. 
Cold, black marble absorbs all light into it's inky blackness, as if night
itself were contained within these unhallowed walls.  Above the cold,
uncaring marble, towers stretch up, still further, scraping and mocking the
heavens.  Roofed in blood red slate, they stand like an accusatory finger,
challenging the Gods themselves.  Set into these impossibly immutable walls,
a double set of gates, cast from a red metal from deep within the earth bear
down on you with their presence.  Intricate scrollwork, alien yet perfect
craftsmanship, crawls spider-like along the metal, forming wards and runes
of power.  As you stand here, it is as if the place itself reaches out, and
begins to tear at your soul, for surely the demons within will consume it
all...  For a second, you consider stepping back, to face the perils of the
swamp.  Well, this is your choice, mortal, dare you go forward, to face the
corruption within?.....

Inside the Main Courtyard of the Castle
  Dread magics have warped and twisted the stone, shaping the slabs into
horrific monuments to deities worshipped as gods by these foul creatures. 
It appears that no form is too corrupt, no evil too twisted for these vile
abominations to use it to their own ends.  All about you, soldiers practice
with their weapons, paying you little heed, focused as they are on hacking
apart practice dummies.  Dummies which bear a striking resemblance to people
you have known...

n
Inside the Main Courtyard of the Castle
  The courtyard continues further into the castle.  The flagstones
themselves are quarried from a black stone, polished by the passing of time
and booted feet into an inky sheen.  All around the courtyard, demons roam,
going about their business, talking in their guttural rasping tongue.  All
manner of dread abomination walks, slithers and crawls; their forms a
corruption of many different creatures, twisted together into a mocking
semblance of their former lives.  All around the edges of the courtyard,
large archways vault upwards, calling you into their maw.

>>    In the Main Dining Hall
  Harried servants, backs bent double under the weight of dirty dishes
shuffle through the dining hall.  With the constant influx of diners, their
work is seldom finished.  The diners take little notice of the servants as
they attempt to keep some order about the tables, usually taking no more
notice of the poor creatures other than to shove them out of their way... 
The poor shoved creature more often than not ending up on the floor under a
mass of broken dishes and leftovers.

In the Main Dining Hall

appearance, and you step carefully to avoid half-eaten bits of food cast

s
A Wide Spot in the Road - The City of Gold
  The road opens up onto a dirt path which leads down the center of this
small town.  A sign, written in yellow paint on weathered boards, declares
that this is the City of Gold.  Whatever the name, there doesn't seem to be
much gold, and it looks like even less of a city.  

[ Exits: north south ]

1013/1126 HP  1182/1550 MP  1354/1355 mv  531tnl  
Lv 53  G 466013 | A Wide Spot in the Road - The City of Gold (NS)
>>    Road to the City of Gold
  The road descends the slope into the valley rapidly here, and is quite
dangerous.  Loose rocks threaten any foothold, and a few cacti line the edge
of the road.  Obviously, this side of the ridge gets much less rain than the
southern side.  

[ Exits: north south ]

A prospector is here trying to make his fortune.

s
Road to the City of Gold
  The road crests a ridge here and suddenly descends into a lowland
valley.  A city can be seen at the bottom of the valley, immediately ahead
of you on the road.  Most of the buildings appear to be made of wood, and
even at this distance appear to have been built quite hastily.

1013/1126 HP  1182/1550 MP  1347/1355 mv  531tnl  
Lv 53  G 466013 | Road to the City of Gold (NS)
s
>>    An Intersection in a Rocky Road
  The road splits here, with a small path leading into a small valley to
the west, and a road heading farther up into the mountains to the east. 
There is a small sign in the bushes under the trees here.  

[ Exits: north south west ]
A native has come from afar to trade for goods.
Quanah Parker says, "There's been a pissing match going on between
 Marshall James and Mad Dog Jake fer a bunch of years now.  They're
 brothers, you see, so this all started back in when they were mites no
 bigger than the bee's knees.  Back then, Mrs. James, their mama, doted on
 the Marshall.  His younger brother, Jake, was pretty much left to his own
 devices, and spent his time killing off pet cats and pulling the wings
 offa flies."

  The small rocky path leads down into a hidden valley.  The sound of
rushing water is nearby, and the air is filled with the fresh mountain
scents.

A Bridge Across a Mountain Stream
  The road narrows onto a small rope bridge here, which crosses a mountain
stream, in a canyon nearly 100 feet below.  The stream is fed by a waterfall
to the about 50 yards to your left, and the spray of water keeps the bridge
soaked all the time.  

[ Exits: east west ]
One of the Marshall's deputies is here, enforcing the law.

Dead End of the Valley Road
  The road dead-ends here at a wide spot before a cliff, which towers
overhead for thousands of feet.  A small mineshaft can be seen in the bottom
of the cliff, just large enough for a mining car to go through.  The beams
don't look very strong, and are newly constructed.

enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.

stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)

adventurers.

goals jenny

                     Goal information for: Jenny's Tavern 
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Ah, Jenny's Tavern.  A wonderful place to go, hang out, have a few too many
ales, and chat with your fellow adventurers.  For years, the owner of the bar
has been in hiding; collecting the money the tavern has generated and hiding
out on an unknown island, living the life of luxury.

That is, until now.  The head chef forgot to freeze last night's chicken, and
in fear of Jenny's wrath due to the loss of revenue, she cooked it anyways, not
caring of the consequences.  Now, everyone in the tavern is sick.  Deathly
sick.  They need your help, and now.  Jenny has come out of hiding, seeking
people to help cure the folks.

Seek Jenny at the entrance of the tavern, if you dare attempt to help the
patrons, possibly putting your own health on the line.

> Say 'lets do this' to Jenny to get back to the goal area.
> You can buy another gas mask from Jenny if you lose yours.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Difficulty       : Easy                
Recommended Level:  91
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
You have not yet unlocked any of the tasks in this quest.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

>>    The Pantry
  You stand in the small pantry which is used to store the food and other
things needed for the busy kitchen of Jenny's Tavern.  Shelves and racks
take up most of the space, and many barrels and crates are stacked in
teetering towers all over the place.  Large baskets of dried herbs and slabs
of meat hang from the ceiling.  A pleasant aroma fills the air, and makes
your mouth water.

southwest is a fire burning in the hearth.  You can pull up a barstool and
order a drink!

Boot Clan Public Hall (G)
  You have wandered out of the Academy and into Boot Camps clanhall. 
Clans are a special thing on aardwolf allowing like minded people to 
come together. Read help clans for more information. Boot Camp is a 
clan designed to help new players learn more about the game and we 
enjoy doing it. Read help boot and help newbieclan to learn more. 
This area is not a part of the Academy and the first thing you should 
do on Aardwolf is complete the Academy goal. We offer newbie starter 
kits to all new players. If you would like one please send a member a 
tell. You can type who boot to see who is online. If they do not 
respond then they are most likely afk. All items in our newbie kits 
are also sold in this shop. Type list if you would like to take a look 
at them. To return to the Academy type north.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A commissary shopkeeper stands here, begging you to type 'list'.

>>    Recreation Room (G)
  Walking into the room, you notice there is a relaxed, friendly atmosphere and
almost everyone is in military uniform. A jukebox is playing a lively tune 
and some of the patrons are having fun dancing to the music. The sound of 
laughter coming from one end of the bar, as someone has just delivered the 
punch line of a good joke. Plush, comfortable looking, couches are scattered 
around the large room in clusters of two and three, allowing for more 
intimate gatherings and private conversations. The enlisted and the officers 
mingle together amicably and everyone is on excellent terms with the 
bartender.

[ Exits: east south west ]
An old veteran stands behind the bar, ready to serve you a cool drink.

942/1126 HP  1209/1550 MP  1355/1355 mv  447tnl

goals jenny

                     Goal information for: Jenny's Tavern 
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Ah, Jenny's Tavern.  A wonderful place to go, hang out, have a few too many
ales, and chat with your fellow adventurers.  For years, the owner of the bar
has been in hiding; collecting the money the tavern has generated and hiding
out on an unknown island, living the life of luxury.

That is, until now.  The head chef forgot to freeze last night's chicken, and
in fear of Jenny's wrath due to the loss of revenue, she cooked it anyways, not
caring of the consequences.  Now, everyone in the tavern is sick.  Deathly
sick.  They need your help, and now.  Jenny has come out of hiding, seeking
people to help cure the folks.

Seek Jenny at the entrance of the tavern, if you dare attempt to help the
patrons, possibly putting your own health on the line.

> Say 'lets do this' to Jenny to get back to the goal area.
> You can buy another gas mask from Jenny if you lose yours.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Difficulty       : Easy                
Recommended Level:  91
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
You have not yet unlocked any of the tasks in this quest.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

help black lotus
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : 'Black Lotus'.
Help Category : Healing.
Related Helps : Meditation, Mana.
Last Updated  : 2017-08-31 11:28:26.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

This spell cannot be cast by a player, but may be found in potions, pills,
scrolls, etc., throughout the realm.

The Black Lotus is an ancient plant that flowers only under the light of a
new moon.  When gathered by silver scythe and specially prepared, a
concoction of this potent brew will restore Mana and Mystical Energy to any
who imbibe it.


----------------------------------------------------------------------------

>>    
Grandmarket Boulevard
  The crowds are loud, rude, obnoxious, and frustrating.  It's amazing what
people will do to find the best deal.  As your journey continues, you begin
to wonder what you are doing here.  

[ Exits: east south west ]
A goblin carries a large money sack that reads 'Tax'.

943/1126 HP  294/1550 MP  1208/1355 mv  342tnl  
Lv 53  G 468346 | Grandmarket Boulevard (ESW)
>>    Aylorian Pets and Companions
  Cages, crates, boxes, and pens clutter the space.  The area is a ruckus
of animal calls, scratching, and yelps.  A large, black spectral caw stands
perched at the entrance, repeatedly crying out, "Pets may bite, watch your
fingers!" as people enter the area.  A bright yellow sign displays
further information regarding purchases.

[ Exits: east south west ]
(White Aura) Rwaul, the pet shop boy, mindlessly scratches at his collar.

943/1126 HP  294/1550 MP  1208/1355 mv  342tnl  
Lv 53  G 468346 | Aylorian Pets and Companions (ESW)
>>    
w
Welcome to Grandmarket Boulevard! (G)
  All throughout Andolor, the Grand City of Aylor is known for three things.
The first is of course, the mighty, the generous, the magnificent Ivar.  The
second is its impressive architecture.  The third, but not the least
important, is its shopping.  It is said that if there's anything to be
found, somebody is already selling it on the streets of Aylor.  As you look
around the insanely hectic Grandmarket Boulevard, you don't doubt it for one
moment.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]

943/1126 HP  294/1550 MP  1208/1355 mv  342tnl  
Lv 53  G 468346 | Welcome to Grandmarket Boulevard! (NESW)
s
s
>>    
The Aylorian Bank of Ivar (G)
  Many rumors surround the Bank of Ivar.  Older adventurers remember the
primitive bank location and large vault where money was stored.  This bank
consists of a single eldar standing behind a large wooden desk.  He wears
only a simple brown robe and a pair of gloves that provide coverage up to
his shoulders.  The desk houses a single large hole that leads to places
unknown.  Many people have ventured to guess the location of where it leads,
but no one knows for sure.

You watch as the eldar reaches into the hole to pull out pouch after
pouch of perfectly counted gold coins.  The only greater mystery here is how
the eldar is able to manipulate the hole, since any hand that reaches into
the hole pulls back nothing but a bloody stub.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]
(White Aura) The local banker, Phreshnar, sits behind a table with a hole in the center.

943/1126 HP  294/1550 MP  1208/1355 mv  342tnl  
Lv 53  G 468346 | The Aylorian Bank of Ivar (NESW)
s
s
>>    Whitewind Avenue (G)
  You stand on Whitewind Avenue just south of Grandmarket Boulevard. 
Farther south, Whitewind meets up with Darksoil Path in a soft merging of
roadways.  The road here on Whitewind is as white as snow.  You cannot
imagine the thousands of footsteps that the road has endured, but it seems
no worse for wear.  In fact, the road is a pristine snow white and quite
beautiful.  

[ Exits: north south ]
A plump dwarf, Radnir, walks past slowly, admiring the views.

943/1126 HP  294/1550 MP  1208/1355 mv  342tnl  
Lv 53  G 468346 | Whitewind Avenue (NS)
>>    The Intersection of Whitewind and Darksoil (G)
  The loud bustle of Grandmarket Boulevard fills the intersection of
Whitewind Avenue and Darksoil Path.  Whitewind Avenue heads north and south
through the center of the city.  Darksoil Path leads east and west. 
Following Darksoil Path to the west leads you toward oddly shaped houses.  

[ Exits: north east south west down ]

943/1126 HP  294/1550 MP  1208/1355 mv  342tnl  
Lv 53  G 468346 | The Intersection of Whitewind and Darksoil (NESWD)
>>    Whitewind Avenue
  Walking along this section of Whitewind Avenue, strollers can experience
a pleasant aroma of earth and flowers carried on the breeze.  People say
that the smell in the air is an enchantment, part of the mysticism of Aylor
that occurs even in the worst of storms.  The avenue is a pristine white,
which, with its scent, can't help but refresh even the most weary of
adventurers.  

[ Exits: north south ]

943/1126 HP  294/1550 MP  1208/1355 mv  342tnl  
Lv 53  G 468346 | Whitewind Avenue (NS)
s
s
>>    Whitewind Avenue
  The pure white avenue beneath your feet trademarks the road from which
its name originates.  The road travels north and south, this portion of it
laying between Darksoil Path and Faeriefog Lane.  To the south and west, you
see a large residential part that hosts a large attraction that the local
residents are very proud.  Beyond the houses to the east, you can hear the
laughter of children and the splashing of water in the distance.  Residents
and adventurers make their way past, some exploring, others searching for
their future legacies.  

[ Exits: north south ]
A rich haughty eldar strolls past, completely ignoring you.
This noble is walking quite quickly, probably to avoid you!

943/1126 HP  294/1550 MP  1208/1355 mv  342tnl  
Lv 53  G 468346 | Whitewind Avenue (NS)
s
>>    Whitewind Avenue at the corner of Faeriefog Lane
  Whitewind Avenue meets up with Faeriefog Lane here in a T-like
intersection.  Small tendrils of pink fog carry through in a pleasant
display against the pure white background of Whitewind Avenue.  Faeriefog
Lane travels westwardly here, and in the distant south you can see the
southern gates of Aylor.  North continues through to the center of this vast
city.  

[ Exits: north south west ]
A beat-up rat in nasty-looking rags wears a bandana and has a peg for a leg.
A gnome child rushes past you, amazement in her eyes.
(White Aura) The revered Shaman, Kaw-nima, hails from the temperate regions of Gelidus.

943/1126 HP  294/1550 MP  1208/1355 mv  342tnl  
Lv 53  G 468346 | Whitewind Avenue at the corner of Faeriefog Lane (NSW)
s
>>    Whitewind Avenue
  Whitewind Avenue continues north and south with its pleasant breeze and
fresh aroma.  To the north, you can already see the pink wisps of where it
meets with Faeriefog Lane.  To the south, Whitewind continues past
Silvermist Road straight out into the continent of Mesolar.  

[ Exits: north south ]

943/1126 HP  294/1550 MP  1208/1355 mv  342tnl  
Lv 53  G 468346 | Whitewind Avenue (NS)
>>    Whitewind Avenue
  Standing on Whitewind Avenue, to the east you find a home from which
large tree branches force their way out of the windows.  The sounds of birds
singing and insects humming can be heard distinctly over the general din of
the passersby making their way into the city.  Whitewind Avenue continues
north and south.  Silvermist Road can be seen just south of here.  

[ Exits: north (east) south ]
The nobleman, Ludlow Mindwarder III, is ranting at nobody in particular.

943/1126 HP  294/1550 MP  1208/1355 mv  342tnl  
Lv 53  G 468346 | Whitewind Avenue (N[E]S)
s
s
>>    Silvermist Road intersects with Whitewind Avenue
  Here at the corner of Silvermist Road and Whitewind Avenue, the soft mist
for which Silvermist gets its name brushes gently against your arm giving
you a shiver.  The road here travels west, deeper into the residential
district.  To the north and south, Whitewind Avenue continues its way
through the city and out into Andolor.  

[ Exits: north south west ]

943/1126 HP  294/1550 MP  1208/1355 mv  342tnl  
Lv 53  G 468346 | Silvermist Road intersects with Whitewind Avenue (NSW)
>>    Continuing on Whitewind
  Continuing on Whitewind Avenue, you feel refreshed and whole as the dinge
and weariness of battle leaves your body.  The city beckons you deeper, as
people rush past you to explore its finer details.  To the west you see the
residential district, known worldwide for its "unique" housing and citizens.
Travelling south takes you out of the city and into the great expanse of the
world.  

[ Exits: north south ]
This noble is walking quite quickly, probably to avoid you!

n
Whitewind Avenue (G)
  You stand amidst a very crowded portion of Whitewind Avenue.  To the
north is a large mass of people who are waiting in line to speak with
Aylor's great and noble quest master.  To the south even more crowds
gather to find the treasures of Grandmarket Boulevard.  

[ Exits: north south ]
A citizen walks around with his nose in the air.

943/1126 HP  294/1550 MP  1208/1355 mv  342tnl  
Lv 53  G 468346 | Whitewind Avenue (NS)
>>    Among the Philosophes (G)
  To the south of the Grand Plaza is a magnificent Stoa built entirely of
white marble.  A series of steps lead into the body proper of the building,
which is encircled by peristyle ionic columns and decorated in the ionic
style.  The greatest minds of all Andolor congregate here to debate matters
of philosophy, or just to think great thoughts in the same corridors where
thinkers past have done so.  The most sought-out magister of them all is
Questor, who dispenses worldly knowledge and experience by giving
assignments to those who ask.  Those who yearn for knowledge and
understanding flock to the Stoa, and they are never disappointed.  Any time
of day or night, conversations can be heard on subjects as lofty as the
meaning of life and the nature of death and the hereafter.  

[ Exits: north east south up ]
(Player) Hild the Soldier.
A wealthy elven citizen glances at you as she slowly walks past.
The world famous Master Questor of Aylor hands out quests to adventurers.

943/1126 HP  294/1550 MP  1208/1355 mv  342tnl  
Lv 53  G 468346 | Among the Philosophes (NESU)
n
e
>>    
The Grand Plaza (G)
  The south end of the plaza is traditionally home to salesmen of a more
refined sort.  The proximity of the Mage and Psionicist Guilds to the east
and the Stoa to the south guarantee that the sellers of rare books and
antiquities that gather here always have business.  Snatches of excited
conversation about this or that rare edition float about on the air, and
occasionally a voice will be raised to accuse some dishonest peddler of
pushing forgeries.  The Plaza Guards are more numerous here to guarantee the
security of the valuable goods for sale, as well as the safety of the
well-laden coin purses that dangle from the all-too-numerous belts.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A citizen walks around with his nose in the air.

943/1126 HP  294/1550 MP  1208/1355 mv  342tnl  
Lv 53  G 468346 | The Grand Plaza (NESW)
>>    The Grand Plaza
  The air in the southeast corner of the plaza seems constantly charged
with magic.  The Tower of the Mind to the east houses the Guild of
Psionicists, its stones supposedly individually laid using only psychic
will.  To the south is the Tower of Sorcery, colloquially referred to as
Black Cat Tower, which houses the Mages' Guild.  This tower's appearance is
by far the most extreme of all, with several of its higher spires completely
detached from the main structure and floating in the air.  Powerful
sorcerers levitate out from the central edifice at impossible heights in
order to reach the magically-suspended satellite towers where only the most
exalted of the Guild are allowed to congregate.  Like the other guild towers,
these are guarded against outsiders.  Here and there herbalists shout the
lists of exotic spell ingredients they have for sale, while mentalists offer
up a panoply of concentration aids.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]

943/1126 HP  294/1550 MP  1208/1355 mv  342tnl  
Lv 53  G 468346 | The Grand Plaza (NESW)
s
>>    
In Black Cat Tower (G)
  The very air seems to resonate with an electrical intensity inside the
Mages' Guild.  Groups of novices move throughout the tower, making their way
to this or that class, while experienced Spellcasters take advantage of the
libraries or perhaps use the common room as a place to catch up on some
reading.  Familiars are also in evidence-- many of them the sort of onyx
felines that gave the tower its nickname-- running, flying, slithering, or in
some cases oozing in pursuit of some errand given them by their masters. 
The upper levels of the tower are accessed by a series of levitation tubes
that gently pull entering sorcerers up to the next level of the tower.  The
Tower of Sorcery is a place of exotic enchantments and curious cantrips
where wizards of all stripes can find something to learn if pride will let
them be taught.  

[ Exits: north up ]
( 2) (Hum) Fin cut off a Card shark.
     (Invis) (Magic) The jester mask is very vibrant in color.
     (Magic) (Glow) (Hum) A small ring lies here.
     (Invis) (Magic) A monocle lies here.

     (Invis) (Magic) (Hum) This spiked ring looks like it would be uncomfortable to actually wear.

     (Glow) A battered old handbook lays here. [2/4]

     (Invis) (Magic) Someone has misplaced their mask.
     (Invis) (Magic) A feathered masquerade mask lies on the ground.
     (Invis) (Magic) A pair of matching masks have been discarded.
     (Magic) A card shark has lost its teeth here.
The Master of Novices is here to train you in the Arts.

You spend 3 practices to increase fly to 85%.
You are now an expert in fly.
You have 158 practice sessions remaining.

973/1126 HP  329/1550 MP  1261/1355 mv  342tnl  
Lv 53  G 468346 | In Black Cat Tower (NU)
>>    
rtain scribe full
Sorry KumoGami, you can't do that.

973/1126 HP  329/1550 MP  1261/1355 mv  342tnl  
Lv 53  G 468346 | In Black Cat Tower (NU)
>>    
train scribe full
Train syntax:
   train <stat>               - train a stat once.
   train <amount> <stat>      - train a stat multiple times.
   train cost <amount> <stat> - check costs to train a stat multiple times.
   train convert              - convert 10 practices into a training session.
   train practices            - convert a training session into 10 practices.

To check current stats and costs type 'train' with no arguments.
When training multiple stats, amount must be between 1 and the
remaining max number of times you can train that stat.

973/1126 HP  329/1550 MP  1261/1355 mv  342tnl  
Lv 53  G 468346 | In Black Cat Tower (NU)
>>    


train scrolls
Train syntax:
   train <stat>               - train a stat once.
   train <amount> <stat>      - train a stat multiple times.
   train cost <amount> <stat> - check costs to train a stat multiple times.
   train convert              - convert 10 practices into a training session.
   train practices            - convert a training session into 10 practices.

To check current stats and costs type 'train' with no arguments.
When training multiple stats, amount must be between 1 and the
remaining max number of times you can train that stat.

help exotic
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : Exotic.
Help Category : Equipment.
Related Helps : Weapons.
Last Updated  : 2017-08-15 18:22:03.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

'Exotic' is the ability to use items that might not normally be considered
a weapon. The resourceful adventurer can find various ways to inflict pain
on a target using all kinds of common items and some not-so-common items.

Because of the wide variety of possibilities for this weapon type, it is
very difficult to practice and natural proficiency grows more slowly.


----------------------------------------------------------------------------

1126/1126 HP  1492/1550 MP  1355/1355 mv  312tnl  
Lv 53  G 468346 | In Black Cat Tower (NU)

Stone Archway
  A chilled breeze rushes through the dark, rough-hewn cavern. The walls are 
covered in scripts and glyphs, visible through an eerie glow that barely 
penetrates the darkness. Broken planks and discarded potion bottles litter 
the floor and a sign of some sort is engraved with a message.

[ Exits: west up ]
A piece of the cavern ceiling crumbles to the ground startling you.

w
d
Inside the Archway
  There is no visible light source in the cavern.  Even light brought in
anticipation of the darkness seems to wither and fail in the curse of this
place.  With every step, the walls seem to shrink in, making the air thick
and musty.  The sounds here echo all around with no definite source.  
 
            Sounds echo in your ears.....
                  Sounds echo in your mind.....
                        Sounds echo in your imagination.....
 
The ground begins to descend to deeper unseeable depths.

[ Exits: north east down ]
(Translucent) Within the dark passage, movement briefly catches your eye.

sloped low, barely enough room to stand upright.  The air is heavy, thick,
and the grit of this underground deathtrap hangs heavy in the air.  Sounds
continue the assault from all directions.

>>    On a Secondary Stage
  There are several beautiful women dancing around.  The sweet smell of the

1126/1126 HP  1504/1550 MP  1355/1355 mv  304tnl  
Lv 53  G 468471 | Outside the Boss's Office (NS)
>>    Boss's Personal Chamber
  Simple candlelight lights this room.  No expense has been spared.  Red
silk draperies are on the walls to either side, and a large banner rests
behind the Boss himself.  He sits alone at the desk, no guards blocking him.

quickly.

Black Magiks (1336)

Dark Guard Chamber
  Another room which has the air of enforcement about it, this dimly lit
place leaves the scent of sweat heavy in the nostrils.  Dark red stains on
the walls and floors leave no doubt that this is a place where one's guard
should never be let down.  The sounds here are more subdued, having left the
hectic market and other distractions above.  Serious business is
accomplished in these halls, and there is no doubt as to the penalty for
causing mischief.

Slaver's Route (1326)

Before the East Entrance (G)
  You stand just at the east entrance to the Underdark.  Before you looms a
huge cavern, or so you think, since you can't tell with your eyes.  Darkness
is everywhere, there is a layer of light that has been formed by a series of
floating orbs that rest above your head.  Above this layer of light, darkness
lies.  It is because of this that you think you stand in a huge cavern.  The
air smells of thousands living in a confined space with little fresh air.  The
air itself is moist and warm.  Sounds assault your ears, not just the buzzing
of people, but also agonized screams.  The shadows seem to speak of
death.  Welcome to the Underdark. 
 
The north and south is Sunrise, to the east is the entrance and to the west is
the Slaver's Route and farther down, the market area.

[ Exits: north (east) south west ]
A dark dwarf wanders about.

A quiet glade (G)
  You are in a quiet glade nested between the banks of the Dragon River.  A
strange aura exists in this room.  You feel like Alice about to fall down
the rabbit hole.  Perhaps you should sleep and see what happens?

Lv 53  G 469123 | A quiet glade (NESW*)
>>    Fantasizing
  Closing your eyes, you feel yourself being transported into a new world,
one of fantasies both good and bad.  The Fantasy Fields stretch in many
directions, encompassing visions of delight and horror.  Where you stand,
the grass is green and a cool breeze blows.  Thundering sounds of the
waterfall nearby echo around you, almost but not quite drowning out the
gentle trickling of the creek beside you that self-same waterfall feeds.

  Alas, it seems the strangeness of this world is too much for your mind to

eyes partially, you see the world called 'reality' around you.  It is your
choice to wake up and allow that world to take over or to close your eyes
and enter Fantasy once again.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

On the murky river
  You are carried along slowly by the flow of this muddy river.  Huge trees

Colorful birds dart overhead, chasing the clouds of droning insects.

On a jungle path
  A muddy bank leads to a narrow path threading around these huge trees. 
The oppressive humidity of the jungle presses down on you like a hot, wet
sheet.  The thick canopy overhead only allows dim green light to filter
through.  The path leads off to the east and the river is back to the south.

>>    On a jungle path
  The canopy of branches and leaves looms roundly above you, blotting out the 
sky. The air is heavy with moisture and the scent of wild orchids 
intermingled with the smell of rotting leaves and wood. Your feet sink in the
spongey moss-covered ground as you make your way slowly through the jungle.
The path continues east and west.

On an old bridge
  Here is the most dilapidated bridge you have ever seen!  Its weathered
grey planks are splintered and broken and more than half of them are
missing.  You look over the edge to see the rotting pilings sunk deep into
the mud banks.  Apparently, there is no other way across.  Gathering your
courage, you take one slow, careful step out onto the bridge.  It shudders
and groans under your weight.  I hope you make it across!  

[ Exits: north south ]

399/1126 HP  840/1550 MP  1355/1355 mv  88tnl  
Lv 53  G 470052 | A path through the village (NESW)
>>    
s
A path through the village
  This village sure is not very big!  At this end, it backs right up
against the jungle.  Maybe a dozen huts can be seen from here, a few with
their doors open.  Women cook and sew while the men hunt or tend the fields.
Boys fetch water from the river and girls take care of their younger
siblings.  Everyone is busy.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]
     A stone fountain provides the village with cool, sweet, clean water.
     A lychee tree grows here, its branches filled with ripe fruits.
A boy carries water.
A dark-eyed woman in a colorful sari prepares food for her family.
Riki Tiki Tavi patrols the garden for threats to the boy.

sounds have receded and animal sounds have emerged.  You barely hear the
shouts of children playing to the north.

On a jungle path
  Traveling this jungle heat saps your strength.  Overhead, you catch
occasional glimpses of small mammals and reptiles.  The calls of various
brightly colored birds are sharp notes against the soothing drone of
insects.  

[ Exits: east west ]
     These vines hang from many trees.
     A sweet orange tree grows here, its branches filled with ripe oranges.
This blue sheep has been separated from its flock.
A crested serpent eagle soars by, watching everything.
A huge, lavender orchid hangs from a tree.

>>    In the foothills
  The path starts to rise and the ground is a bit drier as you travel into
the foothills.  Less brush blankets the ground and the trees are further
apart, allowing more sun to penetrate.  There is still plenty of shade and a
cool breeze blows down from the high mountain peaks.

>>    At a cave entrance
  A cave opens into this steep rock face.  The opening is irregular, wider
at the top than at the bottom.  Ferns grow all around and vines partially
obscure the opening.  Years of decaying plant matter soften the rock floor,
cushioning your footsteps.

In a Cave
  Phew, what a stink!  You are in a medium sized cave.  The floor is
covered in bat guano.  Overhead, the high-pitched squeals and squeaks of
hundreds of bats can be heard.  Too bad the villagers don't know about this
place.  All this fertilizer could be valuable.

427/1126 HP  879/1550 MP  1354/1355 mv  88tnl  
Lv 53  G 470052 | A path through the village (NESW)
>>    
n
A path through the fields
  Here the path is wider and smoother.  Prints from many feet can be seen
in the packed dirt.  Cultivated fields stretch out on either side of you,
verdant green in the sun.  Shouts and laughter of children at play reach
your ears.  Everything appears peaceful, but beware what lurks in the grass.
West is the village shrine and south is the village itself.  East leads back
to the fields.  

[ Exits: east south west ]

In a Field
  This field grows millet, the staple grain of these people.  The nearly
ripe grain heads hang heavy on the stem.  The breeze ripples through the
field like waves on the ocean.  Soon, the villagers will come and harvest
this field with hand sickles.  The young children will follow the
harvesters, gleaning every bit of grain they find.  

[ Exits: north ]
     This tiny grain plant is nearly ripe.

Lv 53  G 470052 | A path through the fields (ESW)
s
>>    In a small shrine
  It's obvious that all the wealth and artistic expression in this humble
village go to this small shrine.  A large statue of Ganesha is here, an
offering of fragrant incense lit at its base.  The walls are covered with
colorful, exquisitely detailed paintings.  Fragrant flowers, mostly orchids,
cover the altar.  

[ Exits: east ]
     (Glow) This burning incense is scented with sandalwood.
     A cluster of fragrant, yellow orchids hang from a tree.
(White Aura) A statue of the elephant-headed Hindu god, Shri Ganesha graces this temple.
Shri Ganesha asks, "This village's prayers have brought me to life.  They
 are in dire need of help and have little time to spare.  Will you help
 them?"
Shri Ganesha stares at you, awaiting your answer.

427/1126 HP  879/1550 MP  1339/1355 mv  88tnl  
Lv 53  G 470052 | On a jungle path (NW)
n
n
>>    On an old bridge
  Here is the most dilapidated bridge you have ever seen!  Its weathered
grey planks are splintered and broken and more than half of them are
missing.  You look over the edge to see the rotting pilings sunk deep into
the mud banks.  Apparently, there is no other way across.  Gathering your
courage, you take one slow, careful step out onto the bridge.  It shudders
and groans under your weight.  I hope you make it across!  

[ Exits: north south ]

427/1126 HP  879/1550 MP  1338/1355 mv  88tnl

  Walking through this jungle heat saps your strength.  Overhead, you catch
occasional glimpses of small mammals and reptiles.  The calls of various
brightly colored birds are sharp notes against the soothing drone of
insects.  Nearby, you can smell the fragrant bark of a cinnamon tree.  
The path continues west and south.

In a small shrine
  It's obvious that all the wealth and artistic expression in this humble
village go to this small shrine.  A large statue of Ganesha is here, an
offering of fragrant incense lit at its base.  The walls are covered with
colorful, exquisitely detailed paintings.  Fragrant flowers, mostly orchids,
cover the altar.  

[ Exits: east ]
     (Glow) This burning incense is scented with sandalwood.
     A cluster of fragrant, yellow orchids hang from a tree.
(White Aura) A statue of the elephant-headed Hindu god, Shri Ganesha graces this temple.
Shri Ganesha asks, "This village's prayers have brought me to life.  They
 are in dire need of help and have little time to spare.  Will you help
 them?"
Shri Ganesha stares at you, awaiting your answer.

goals Raganatittu

                     Goal information for: Raganatittu 
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
The villagers of Raganatittu have prayed to their gods for help; help against
disease, and help against the dangerous creatures that compete for their 
niche in the jungle between the Raganatittu River and the mountain ranges to 
the east It appears that their prayers may be answered. Ganesha, the elephant
god has arrived in the village. Will help arrive from an unlikely quarter?
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Difficulty       : Medium              
Recommended Level:  40
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
You have not yet unlocked any of the tasks in this quest.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

 of the problem.  Please make haste and return to me when this is no longer
 an issue."

help cure critical
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : 'Cure Critical'.
Help Category : Healing.
Related Helps : Cure Light, Cure Serious, heal.
Last Updated  : 2017-07-30 23:14:38.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Syntax: cast 'cure critical' <character>
Spell Number: 24

This spell calls upon the gods to heal a large amount of wounds, though
it is less effective than heal.

Primary stat: Wisdom.
Affected by : None.

1107/1143 HP  1156/1575 MP  1371/1371 mv  899tnl  
Lv 54  G 470743 | Medical lounge (E[D])
>>    
help heal
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : HEAL HEALER.
Help Category : Utility.
Related Helps : Black Lotus, Cure Light, Cure Serious, Cure Critical, Heal Spell, Refresh, Remove
Curse.
Last Updated  : 2012-12-23 04:48:09.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
If you were looking for help on the Heal spell, see 'help heal spell'.

Syntax:  heal            : List heal options, keywords, and costs
         heal <keyword>  : Buy given healer option

The 'heal' command is used to interact with an in-room healer mobile, such
as the priestess north of recall.  Healers are able to sell healing and
curative spells, for a price.

Type 'heal' in a room with a healer mobile to find the charges for each
spell.  If there is no healer in the room you're in, you will be told such.

Type heal with the desired argument to purchase that spell.  It will be
cast only once; you may need to buy it again if it is unsuccessful.  Also,
note that some healers are more powerful than others.  If you are having
difficulty getting a successful casting, you may want to find a different
healer.  (Rumor has it that clan healers generally get more business and
are thus a bit more experienced than their counterparts out in the field.)

Healer mobiles will give out (for free) a few spells to players level 20
and under, if that player is willing to wait for them.  This is best
accomplished in rooms that do not have a lot of other traffic.

There is also a video which shows what to do at a healer on Aardwolf:

                      http://youtu.be/te7hIu09kYU

----------------------------------------------------------------------------

1107/1143 HP  1156/1575 MP  1371/1371 mv  899tnl  
Lv 54  G 470743 | Medical lounge (E[D])
>>    


help heal spell
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : 'Heal Spell'.
Help Category : Healing.
Related Helps : Black Lotus, Cure Light, Cure Serious, Cure Critical, Refresh, Remove Curse.
Last Updated  : 2020-05-25 11:58:53.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Syntax: cast heal <character>
Spell Number: 54

This spell heals a great amount of wounds. For primary class clerics, it
heals an even greater amount of wounds, whether cast directly or taken
from a potion.  The cleric must be extremely wise to derive the greatest
benefit from this spell.  Level also has a small effect on the amount 
healed by this spell. Heal and similar spells are less effective during
PK battles.

Primary stat: Wisdom.


----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.

Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

enter gangway
"gangway"
You step into the gangway and arrive in...
Inside the trader, Typhoon
  You find yourself in a ship, full of opportunities. But don't let the Typhoon
captain catch you here! He can be very nasty after a full bottle of whiskey.
But that's only if he is awakened from his drunken stupor. So this is one of 
the famous trade ships of Lem-Dagor. It's not very impressive right now, as 
it doesn't seem to have a very valuable cargo at the moment.

[ Exits: north ]
Polaf den Tedra has dressed himself snappy today.

[*Daily Blessing*] 993/1143 HP  1437/1575 MP  1370/1371 mv  737tnl  
Lv 54  G 471243 | Inside the trader, Typhoon (N)
>>    


n
The Cargo Bay
  The cargo room is quite big, compared to the size of the vessel. There are 
several cages with creatures inside. Around the table in the middle of the 
room, four traders are playing a strange card game. "I tap your Abyssal 
Spectre with my Icy Manipulator" one trader says.

[ Exits: (north) south ]

enter window
"window"
You step into a huge window and arrive in...
Bosun Tofi opens the entryway before him.
Bosun Tofi exclaims, "Hello KumoGami, welcome to the Tempest!"
The Storm Cruiser, Tempest
  Yes indeed, you are now experiencing one of the many great adventures of the 
Storm Ships of Lem-Dagor. Of course this is the famous cruiser, Tempest, 
where your voyage begins. Look around, look at everything for a clue. There 
is a big sign for you to read.

[ Exits: east west ]
     (Magic) A gangway leads to an unknown ship.
Bosun Tofi stands by.

[*Daily Blessing*] 1035/1143 HP  1504/1575 MP  1371/1371 mv  737tnl  
Lv 54  G 471243 | The Storm Cruiser, Tempest (EW)
>>    
read sign
Dear voyagers, this area is not like all other areas you have gone
before.  In fact some traps and riddles are completely nuts, but never
impossible.  The only thing that could happen is that you are trapped
forever..  Wait for an imm to get you out.  Just do not whine about it. 
Whoever whines will be put on a list, and will not be helped to get out.  
 

[*Daily Blessing*] 1035/1143 HP  1504/1575 MP  1371/1371 mv  737tnl  
Lv 54  G 471243 | The Storm Cruiser, Tempest (EW)
>>    


e
A Shiny Hallway
  The walls of the hallway on the Tempest always have bright colors, and are 
bathing in a shiny, mysterious light. Crew members are walking in several 
directions, looking very busy. They keep moving on along the Hall way, and 
never seem to reach their goal.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
(White Aura) A man is working with a strange device.

[*Daily Blessing*] 1062/1143 HP  1531/1575 MP  1371/1371 mv  737tnl  
Lv 54  G 471243 | A Shiny Hallway (NESW)
>>    
n
A Shiny Hallway
  You are at the north end of the hallway. There is a stairwell west from you,
which could bring you to several far-away places of the ship. South is the 
way to the ship's entrance, the Imaginarium and the main engineer room. From 
the east you hear the sounds of men and women talking, laughing and eating.

[ Exits: east south west ]
A crew member smiles at you as she passes by.
A crew member smiles at you as she passes by.

[*Daily Blessing*] 1062/1143 HP  1531/1575 MP  1371/1371 mv  737tnl  
Lv 54  G 471243 | A Shiny Hallway (ESW)
>>    
e
Tigi's Bar
  Below Decks, the domain of Tigi, is the socializing place of the Tempest.
You see several tables and seats situated in a perfect order. Many people 
visit this place to have a chat with fellow crew members, to have a drink at 
the bar, or to have a wonderful meal. A huge window fills the north side of 
the room completely and gives a wonderful view on the ocean. At this moment 
it is showing a small ship.

[ Exits: west ]
An engineer tries to fix things.
A small and very wise looking woman stands behind the bar.

w
The Sick Bay
  The 'hospital' smell, which you noticed in the hallway, is quite strong
here.  Many beds are situated in a row and made up with snow white sheets. 
The shelves on the walls are full of medical supplies.  You take one of them
and try to use it.  But as you can't find out how, you put it back on its
place.  

[ Exits: east ]
     (Magic) A small cabinet hangs against the wall.
A crew member smiles at you as she passes by.
A woman with long grey hair is searching for something.

e
The Main Engineer Room
  You have entered a large and busy room. All four walls are filled with 
benches worked at by a group of ensigns. In the center of the room, you see a
very large table with wind maps on it. Everyone is working calmly - no sign 
of upcoming trouble. Finn Yeoma has everything under control.

[ Exits: east west ]
You see a promising ensign, who can't wait to get into action.
(White Aura) A man with an armful of maps and a very large compass moves from ensign to ensign,
enquiring on their progress.

[*Daily Blessing*] 1062/1143 HP  1531/1575 MP  1371/1371 mv  737tnl  
Lv 54  G 471243 | The Main Engineer Room (EW)
>>    
e
The Wind Turbine Room
  The wind turbines running the ship's engines create a strong humming sound 
that pulses like the heartbeats of a hundred slaves. The intricacies of the 
storm ship's engines are known only to a privileged few. It takes years of 
study of the ocean currents and understanding the whims of the wind spirits 
to master the maneuvering of a storm ship.

[ Exits: west ]
     (Magic) (Glow) (Hum) You see a structure supporting a wind turbine at the end of the hall.
     (Magic) (Glow) (Hum) A wind turbine is turning rapidly.
A crew member smiles at you as she passes by.
(Invis) (Hidden) You see a young stowaway trying to hide from you.

The Imaginarium
  You look around, wonderingly, at this strange, empty space. The walls are 
cloud-like, with mist streaming from them, not upwards but sideways. It 
swirls, smoke-like as it reaches you, then moves past. Perusing the room more
carefully, you notice that on the north wall the mist is lacking somehow.

Boot Clan Public Hall (G)
  You have wandered out of the Academy and into Boot Camps clanhall. 
Clans are a special thing on aardwolf allowing like minded people to 
come together. Read help clans for more information. Boot Camp is a 
clan designed to help new players learn more about the game and we 
enjoy doing it. Read help boot and help newbieclan to learn more. 
This area is not a part of the Academy and the first thing you should 
do on Aardwolf is complete the Academy goal. We offer newbie starter 
kits to all new players. If you would like one please send a member a 
tell. You can type who boot to see who is online. If they do not 
respond then they are most likely afk. All items in our newbie kits 
are also sold in this shop. Type list if you would like to take a look 
at them. To return to the Academy type north.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A commissary shopkeeper stands here, begging you to type 'list'.

Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

[ Exits: east (down) ]
     A refrigerated milk cooler stands ready to serve all.
     Multiple beds line the wall, waiting for people to rest or be treated on them.
     An old electric heater.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) (White Aura) (Linkdead) (OPK) Breathe in, Breathe out..
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

>>    *[NOEXP]* Mudpits (G)

As you continue down the fields,you realize that 
this was once a battlefield of the worthy and ruthless
but it has now been swept and turned into a training
ground.
Apart from the worn paths and unpleasant pools of mud,
this field is still be used as a training center, and
an older man in a brown uniform who is as tough as
nails.

Recreation Room (G)
  Walking into the room, you notice there is a relaxed, friendly atmosphere and
almost everyone is in military uniform. A jukebox is playing a lively tune 
and some of the patrons are having fun dancing to the music. The sound of 
laughter coming from one end of the bar, as someone has just delivered the 
punch line of a good joke. Plush, comfortable looking, couches are scattered 
around the large room in clusters of two and three, allowing for more 
intimate gatherings and private conversations. The enlisted and the officers 
mingle together amicably and everyone is on excellent terms with the 
bartender.

[ Exits: east south west ]
An old veteran stands behind the bar, ready to serve you a cool drink.

A crack in the valley floor
  The valley you travel through is marred by an opening caused by a
recent earthquake.  The sun casts trails of light that reach deep in
the opening illuminating what appears to be mason work.  Looking in,
you can see that the sides of the crevasse form a rough staircase 
leading into the gloom.

>>    *[NOEXP]* The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

>>    *[NOEXP]* Outside the Aylorian Academy (G) (1370)

Boot Clan Public Hall (G)
  You have wandered out of the Academy and into Boot Camps clanhall. 
Clans are a special thing on aardwolf allowing like minded people to 
come together. Read help clans for more information. Boot Camp is a 
clan designed to help new players learn more about the game and we 
enjoy doing it. Read help boot and help newbieclan to learn more. 
This area is not a part of the Academy and the first thing you should 
do on Aardwolf is complete the Academy goal. We offer newbie starter 
kits to all new players. If you would like one please send a member a 
tell. You can type who boot to see who is online. If they do not 
respond then they are most likely afk. All items in our newbie kits 
are also sold in this shop. Type list if you would like to take a look 
at them. To return to the Academy type north.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A commissary shopkeeper stands here, begging you to type 'list'.
